body: A curved [[sword]] originating from the ancient kingdoms in Ethiopia.

title: estoc_(weapon)
body:
A type of long, slender thrusting [[sword]] with a cruciform hilt and a grip for two-handed use, used in the late Medieval and Renaissance period. Essentially a type of highly specialized [[long sword]], the blade of an estoc is very stiff and usually has a diamond-shaped cross section. Because any edge on an estoc's blade is usually vestigial, it is unsuited to cutting but excels at thrusting and as an anti-armor weapon.

h4. See also
* [[Longsword]]

title: xenogears
body:
JRPG developed and published by Squaresoft (now Square Enix) for the Sony [[Playstation 1]]. Released on February 11, 1998 in Japan and on October 21, 1998 in North America.

It is part of the Xeno metaseries alongside [[Xenosaga]] and [[Xenoblade Chronicles (series)|]].

The story follows the protagonist [[Fei Fong Wong]] and several others in a journey to overthrow the rule of Solaris, an advanced tyrannical society floating in the sky. The game features [[mecha]] called Gears.

title: bartholomew_kuma
body:
[[One Piece]] character. One of the [[Shichibukai]]. A high-powered [[cyborg]] as a result of [[Dr. Vegapunk]]'s experiments, the Pacifista, a high-powered combat androids, are modeled after him. He is considered a "walking mystery", with his true motivations unknown.

Having consumed the Nikyu Nikyu no Mi [[Devil Fruit]], he has paw pads on his hands (and presumably feet) with the power to deflect anything, which he uses in various creative ways.

[spoiler]He was formerly a commander in the Revolutionary Army and [[Jewelry Bonney]]'s adoptive father. Kuma surrendered himself to the World Government in an attempt to find a cure for Bonney's disease. In doing so, Kuma voluntarily allowed himself to be modified into a cyborg and being erased of all emotions, despite objection from Vegapunk. His memories would be later secretly allocated into his programming by Vegapunk in hope that Bonney will be capable of bringing him back to who he once was.[/spoiler]

title: shirahoshi
body:
[[One Piece]] character. Princess Shirahoshi is a [[giantess|giant]] smelt-whiting [[mermaid]] and the princess of the Fish-Man Island.

The daughter of [[neptune_(one_piece)|Neptune]] and [[otohime_(one_piece)|Otohime]], she has three older brothers; [[Fukaboshi]], [[Ryuuboshi]] and [[Manboshi]] as well as a pet shark [[Megalo]].

[spoiler]Unbeknownst to her and those around her, she is the modern incarnation of "Poseidon", one of the three Ancient Weapons that is said to be capable of destroying the world. "Poseidon" being the power of communicating and controlling the Sea Kings, gigantic and powerful sea creatures.[/spoiler]

h4. External links

* "Fandom: Shirahoshi":http://onepiece.fandom.com/wiki/Shirahoshi

title: charlotte_pudding
body:
[[One Piece]] character. Pudding is the 76th child of [[Charlotte Linlin|Big Mom]], an officer of the Big Mom Pirates, and a hybrid between a human and a member of the Three-Eye Tribe.

She is initially arranged to be married with [[Sanji (one piece)|]] as a part of the regicide plan against the Vinsmoke family, but ended up genuinely fallen in love with him for real in the events of Whole Cake Island Arc.

Her most defining feature is her [[third eye]] on her forehead, which is usually covered by her bang. 

Having consumed the Memo Memo no Mi [[Devil Fruit]], she can turn people's memories into strips of film and manipulate them.

title: boa_hancock
body:
[[One Piece]] character. She is the captain of the Kuja Pirates and the current empress of Amazon Lily. Also known as the "Snake Princess" and "Pirate Empress" due to her beauty, and one of the [[Shichibukai]].

She has two younger sisters, [[Boa Sandersonia|Sandersonia]] and [[Boa Marigold|Marigold]], and is often seen alongside her pet snake [[Salome (one piece)|]]. She would later on developed a crush on [[Monkey D. Luffy|Luffy]] during the Amazon Lily Arc.

Having consumed the Mero Mero no Mi [[Devil Fruit]], she can fire heart beams, bullets and arrows that turn anyone who is caught by her charm into stone.

[spoiler]Hancock along with her sisters were kidnapped and sold as slaves to a member of the [[Celestial Dragons (one piece)|]] during their childhood. Because of this, she suffered much abuse while enslaved and developed a hatred for males. Hancock's hatred later softened after she developed a crush on Luffy, who was the first man who acknowledged her suffering.[/spoiler]

title: g10n_fugaku
body:
An [[Imperial Japanese Navy]] ultra-long range heavy bomber project developed during [[World War II]]. As with other bombers, it received mountain-related name, in this case the plane was named after [[Mount Fuji]].

The plane was designed as a part of Project Z, a project of the IJN to develop a heavy bomber capable of reaching the American mainland (much like Germany's "own project":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Heinkel_He_277] and, inversely, [[XB-35|the]] [[B-36 Peacemaker|American's]]). Due to the lack of materials and worsening war situation of Japan, the project was ultimately cancelled in 1944.

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Nakajima G10N":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nakajima_G10N]

title: anchor_(nikke)
body:
Character from [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]]. A member of the [[Aegis (nikke)|Aegis squad]] alongside [[Helm (nikke)|]] and [[Mast (nikke)|]]. 

A Nikke from Aegis squad, who is passionate about marine life. She is equipped with high-performance radar detectors inside her body, so she has made a significant contribution to the Admire's voyage and combat. 

She has [[blue eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[blue hair]] with [[small breasts]]. Her outfit consists of a [[wet]] [[see-through clothes|see-through]] [[serafuku]], [[headband]], [[blue skirt|blue]] [[pleated skirt]] and [[white thighhighs]].

Illustrator: [[Mikan03_26]]

h4. Appearance

* !post #6678101: Default
* !asset #24664744: [[anchor (anchor the diver) (nikke)|Anchor the Diver]]
* !asset #24664735: [[anchor (innocent maid) (nikke)|Innocent Maid]]

title: mast_(nikke)
body:
A character from [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]] and a member of the [[Aegis (nikke)|]] squad along with [[Helm (nikke)|]] and [[Anchor (nikke)|]].

Mast has longed to hit the high seas ever since she first saw the swashbuckling adventures portrayed in pirate films as a child. As time drew on, however, her soul-crushing tenure at the Naval Squad slowly made her disillusioned. Even so, her vibrant personality remains untarnished, and she always brightens everyone else's day aboard the ship she serves. She is often accompanied by a [[parrot]] named [[Morgan (nikke)|]].

She has [[purple eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[streaked hair|streaked]] [[black hair|black]]/[[pink hair]] tied in a [[twintails]] along with [[large breasts]]. Her outfit is a [[military uniform]] consisting of [[white shirt]] exposing her [[black bikini top]] with her [[white jacket]] with [[epaulettes]] are hanging on her shoulders, [[choker]], [[peaked cap]], [[black gloves]], [[white shorts]] and a pair of [[high heels]].

Illustrator: [[DFM (darknessdfm)|DarknessDFM]]

h4. Appearance

title: slippers
body:
A type of soft closed-toe, flat heeled [[shoes|shoe]] meant to be worn indoors.

title: luigi_di_savoia_duca_degli_abruzzi_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Italian cruiser [i]Luigi di Savoia Duca degli Abruzzi[/i]. Character design by [[Jiji (aardvark)|]]. 

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[pink hair]], [[pink eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[collared shirt|collared]] [[red shirt]] top with [[armpit cutout]]s and an [[aiguillette]], [[white shirt|white]] undershirt for the bust, [[red skirt]], [[red boots|red]] [[knee boots]], and [[white gloves]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of two hull pieces with the [[Regia Marina]]'s red-white stripes, four 152 mm triple/twin mounts, and 533 mm triple [[torpedo tubes]].

title: hoolay_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
A non-playable [[Honkai: Star Rail]] boss character, appearing with the 2.4/2.5 Trailblaze Continuance story. 

While he is normally portrayed as a [[wolf|Borisin]], his species, he is also shown in a disguised [[fox boy|Foxian]] form. His disguised attributes are [[red eyes]], [[long hair|long]] [[white hair]], white [[beard]], [[fox ears]], a [[muscular]] build, and a [[chest tattoo]] on his left pectoral. He also wears a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[blue shirt]] in the [[hadanugi dousa]] style, [[bandages]] on his chest, [[grey pants]], and [[black boots|black]] [[ankle boots]].

title: unryuu_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese aircraft carrier [i]Unryuu[/i]. Character designed by [[Kuuro Kuro]], voiced by [[Kawasumi Ayako]]. 

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]] tied into a long [[braid]], [[brown eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. Despite [[unryuu_(aircraft_carrier)|her]] design being based off [i]Hiryuu[/i], she has a starkly different guise because she spent her final sortie in Chinese waters.

Her default base outfit consists of a [[blue vest|blue]] and [[white vest]] with green trim, [[white skirt|white]] [[miniskirt]] and [[green thighhighs]] along with greaves and [[platform footwear|platform]] [[rudder footwear|rudder shoes]]. Most parts of her clothes have cloud-like patterning as a reference to her name ([i]Cloud Dragon[/i]). Her [[rigging]] is based off her real-life bridge and platforms with several [[anti-aircraft gun]]s, which can be operated with a built-in trigger, while she uses a [[staff]] for her shikigami aircraft with her real-life [[flight deck]] used as a banner. 

She is depicted as a highly calm individual, with degrees of her "coolness" varying in several fan works. Some depict her as stoic and somewhat air-headed, others as very ladylike and quiet, or even almost [[expressionless]] in some cases.

title: gregory_house
body:
Gregory House is a fictional character and the titular protagonist of the American medical drama series [[house m.d.|House]]. Created by David Shore and portrayed by English actor Hugh Laurie.

Head of the Department of Diagnostic Medicine at Princeton-Plainsboro Teaching Hospital, with specialties in both Infectious Disease and Nephrology. House did his undergrad at Johns Hopkins; he also attended medical school there but was expelled for cheating and ultimately got his degree from the University of Michigan. House is a brilliant doctor; unfortunately for everyone around him, he's also a misanthrope and an arrogant jerk to everyone he meets. He walks with a [[cane]] as a result of an infarction he suffered in his right thigh and the surgery that tried to correct it; the pain from this drives his Vicodin addiction as well.

title: star_wars
body:
An epic American space opera franchise created by filmmaker [[George Lucas]]. It is a [[science fiction]] and [[fantasy]] story set in a faraway galaxy.

The saga began with the release of the "original trilogy", consisting of [[Star Wars: A New Hope|A New Hope]] in 1977, [[Star Wars: The Empire strikes back|The Empire Strikes Back]] in 1980 and [[Star Wars: return of The Jedi|Return of the Jedi]] in 1983. 

Because of its huge success across the world during the late 70s, several Japanese anime and manga from that era were heavily inspired by it.

A "prequel trilogy" (set chronologically before the original trilogy) was released in 1999, 2002 and 2005. The trilogy consists of [[Star Wars: The Phantom Menace|The Phantom Menace]], [[Star Wars: Attack of the Clones|Attack of the Clones]] and [[Star Wars: Revenge of the Sith|Revenge of the Sith]]. After the series rights were sold by Lucas to [[Disney]], a new "sequel trilogy" was announced in 2012. This trilogy began with [[Star Wars: The Force Awakens|The Force Awakens]] in 2015 and continued with [[Star Wars: The Last Jedi|The Last Jedi]] in 2017 and [[Star Wars: The Rise of Skywalker|The Rise of Skywalker]] in 2019.

Several animated series related to the main saga were also released. Among them was [[Star Wars: Clone Wars]] in 2003, [[Star Wars: The Clone Wars]] in 2008, [[Star Wars: Rebels]] in 2014 and [[Star Wars: Resistance]] in 2018.  

Two spin-off "Star Wars Anthology" films were released between each sequel film. The first Anthology film, [[Rogue One: A Star Wars Story]], was released in 2016 and is set in the period of the Galactic Civil War of the original films. A film focusing on Han Solo called [[Solo: A Star Wars Story]] was released in 2018.

A live action series called [[The Mandalorian]] and a video game called [[Star Wars Jedi: Fallen Order]] were also released in late 2019.

The Star Wars saga has had a significant impact on popular culture; is one of the highest-grossing media franchises of all time.

title: vodka_(umamusume)
body:
A character from [i][[Umamusume]][/i].
She is determined to live the cool life, no matter where the road of life takes her. Being influenced by her bike-loving father, Vodka grew up to have the same interests and hobbies, always talking about the latest bikes, and shares his same beliefs with a strong conviction. She aims to always look cool and be ready to take on any challenge that life throws her way, in or out the racetrack.
She is voiced by [[Oohashi Ayaka]].

title: sakura_laurel_(umamusume)
body:
Character from [i][[Umamusume]][/i].

A positive-thinking umamusume with a sunny disposition. Although she is sickly by nature and injury-prone due to her fragile legs, she always came back from her setbacks and never gets discouraged. She has a peculiar rivalry with Narita Brian. She also dreams of winning the Prix de l'Arc de Triomphe, becoming a francophile as a result.

Before she was made playable and thus, had her characterization settled, she was usually portrayed in fan-art as a [[yandere|manic obsessive-possessive]] rival to Narita Brian.

Laurel has her own spin-off manga titled [i][[Umamusume: Star Blossom]][/i].

title: duramente_(umamusume)
body:
Character from [i][[Umamusume]][/i]. She has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] with a white streak on her forehead as well as an [[ahoge]]. She comes from a family of athletes and grew up with [[Air Groove (umamusume)|]], whom she calls "Gurunee" (ã‚°ãƒ«å§‰).

She was first introduced as a surprise to viewers watching the premiere of the 3rd season of the [i]Umamusume[/i] anime, where she beat protagonist [[Kitasan Black (umamusume)|]] and [[Satono Crown (umamusume)|]]. Duramente's introduction to the story sent shockwaves among the fanbase, as this meant that other horses of the same owner (Sunday Racing) could now be part of the world of [i]Umamusume[/i]; especially since up to that point the horse was substituted by an original NPC named [[Brusquement_(umamusume)|]].

h4. Appearance

title: air_groove_(umamusume)
body:
[[Umamusume]] character.

Vice President of the Tracen Academy Student Council. Frequently the victim of [[Symboli Rudolf (umamusume)|]]'s [i]horrible[/i] puns.

Air Groove's official character profile originally had a line mentioning that "she hates men because of a certain traumatic incident in a race" (ãƒ¬ãƒ¼ã‚¹ä¸­ã®ã¨ã‚ã‚‹ãƒˆãƒ©ã‚¦ãƒãŒåŸå› ã§ç”·å«Œã„). This was a reference to the 1997 Japan Cup incident where another horse, Pilsudski, won the race in front of Air Groove in spite of said horse flashing at the paddock in front of the crowd (and other horses including Air Groove), which is normally seen as a sign of distraction by Japanese horse racing fans. This line was subsequently removed, but the incident is still referenced in Air Groove's relationship with [[Fine Motion (Umamusume)|]], as the real-life Fine Motion is the half-sister of [[Pilsudski (Racehorse)|]].

h4. Appearance

title: shinko_windy_(umamusume)
body:
[[Umamusume]] character. Resident "biting girl" of the series.

Windy is easily excitable and has a tendency to bite other characters when agitated. Her verbal tic is "~nanoda" (like [[common_raccoon_(kemono_friends)|Raccoon]] from [[Kemono Friends]]). She loves playing pranks (specifically on [[Trainer (Umamusume)|]]s).

Windy's real-life horse counterpart has a nasty habit of biting other horses when racing neck-to-neck near the finish line. This has lost him several races with the horse being "too busy" trying to line up a bite instead of overtaking his opponent. This trait endears him to his fans, oddly.

title: mayano_top_gun_(umamusume)
body:
[[Umamusume]] character. 

A little Maverick of a throughbred, Mayano Top Gun is a young-looking [[horse girl]] who is named as well as having part of her personality based around the movie [[Top Gun]]. When she isn't spouting aeronautical references, she is trying (too hard) to be [[age_conscious|treated as an adult]], yet despite of this she is notably capable of learning quick and is able to grasp the situation such as answering a math question. This is reflected in-game where she is capable of running in different strategies.

Her racing outfit was influenced by the movie [[Top Gun]] (her jacket is nearly identical to that worn by [[Pete "Maverick" Mitchell]]). When it came to promote [[Top Gun: Maverick]] (or, rather, due to her very presence), she was the natural choice to "advertise the movie":[/posts/5348482].

title: symboli_rudolf_(umamusume)
body:
[[Umamusume]] character. Student Council President of Tracen Academy.

Rudolf is infamous for having a penchant for cracking horrible 'dad joke'-level puns. This causes [[Air Groove (Umamusume)|]] (her vice-president) no end of grief.

Japanese fan artists may also sometimes draw a younger version of Rudolf, which they name "Luna". This nickname is derived from the actual childhood name of the real-life [[Symboli Rudolf (racehorse)|]].

title: fine_motion_(umamusume)
body:
[[Umamusume]] character. An exchange student from Ireland who comes from a distinguished family. Loves [[Ramen]].

Unlike all the other [[horse girl]]s, Fine Motion has completely symmetrical [[hair ornament]]s. These consist of four [[clover]]-shaped [[clover hair ornament|hair ornament]]s (three-leaved clovers, each colored in red and outlined in green) arranged in two identical pairs on top of her head, with one pair of clovers each in front of both her left and right ears.

Fine Motion's real-life counterpart is widely rumored to be intersex (appears to be a mare but has male chromosomes and testes). Note that otherwise, she would be treated as a "filly/mare" character (wears [[buruma]] with her [[gym uniform]] and the such) as the original horse ran as one.

title: agnes_digital_(umamusume)
body:
[[Umamusume]] character.

Digital (referred in game as Digi-tan) is a diehard otaku fan of umamusume (analogous to idol otaku in real life). As such she is often found fangirling over her fellow schoolmates/colleagues. She is also frequently depicted cheering or observing the other uma girls from the side, often waving glowsticks around (like RL idol otaku). This trait of hers is exaggerated in fanart, where she will often react violently (i.e. heart attack, massive nosebleed, exploding) [[so_moe_i'm_gonna_die!|to whatever wholesome or adorable event she deems "precious".]] Because of it, she is easily seen both in fanarts or in game, watching other umammusumes or ending up interacting with them.

Her portrayal as an otaku is due to the RL horse's nickname of "Deviant Horse" or "Hentai Horse", referring to the horse's success as a Jack-of-all-trades (and not any particular sexual attraction to other horses). In the game, she thrives on all terrains as well as Mile and Medium distances and is relatively well balanced on stats.

h4. Appearance

title: hishi_akebono_(umamusume)
body:
[[Umamusume]] character. Resident tall girl of the series and American-born returnee. Voiced by [[Matsuzaki Rei]].

Akebono's most salient trait is her massive height at 180 cm (5' 11''). As such she is frequently depicted towering above other characters, both in canon and fanart. Fanart tend to pair her with the some of the shortest characters (e.g. [[Nishino Flower_(umamusume)|]]) to further highlight this [[height difference|disparity]]. Her special ability also involves growing into a donut-giving [[giantess]], playing further more with her size.

title: mihono_bourbon_(umamusume)
body:
Character from [i][[Umamusume]][/i].
Mihono Bourbon has an appropriately stoic and robotic personality to the point that even her character lapses are somehow in-character, often making her do a confused "does not compute" [[blank stare]] Ã  la [[Space Cat (meme)|]].

Ironically, despite her theme, she is terrible with technology, sometimes to the point of frying computers by her simple presence. Her history is intertwined with Rice Shower's as they were rivals in real life. She refers to her [[Trainer (Umamusume)|]] as "Master".

title: nishino_flower_(umamusume)
body:
Character from [i][[Umamusume]][/i]

The obligatory gifted [[child]] character. She is the shortest character overall at 135 cm but this is justified by being [i]an actual preadolescent child[/i]. She is often paired with [[Hishi Akebono_(umamusume)|]], the tallest and largest horse girl of Tracen (at 180 cm tall), simply for the [[height_difference|sheer contrast in size]]. She is also often paired with [[Seiun Sky_(umamusume)|]] due to their real-life relationship (Same owner and one of the few opportunities for Seiun Sky to actually mate as an unpopular stud).

title: dream_journey_(umamusume)
body:
A character from [i][[Umamusume]][/i].

A petite horse girl who follows the path of her esteemed "Elder Sister".

While at 144cm, she isn't the shortest character in the franchise, she has the absolute smallest bust with 66cm. In fact, she has the smallest proportions of any character (B66/W48/H69), having lower measurements than [[Nishino Flower (umamusume)|]] (B67/W48/H70). This is based on the fact that the real Dream Journey was one of the smallest racehorses of his caliber.

h4. Appearance

title: king_halo_(umamusume)
body:
Character from [i][[Umamusume]][/i] and resident "ojou" of the series. As her name says, acts like a haughty noble but she is a good person in heart. Often paired with [[Haru Urara (umamusume)|Urara]] who is her roommate or usually Seiun Sky. 

She is infamous for being one of the hardest characters to train in the game due to the wide range of distances she is expected to race on. Thankfully, she is at least competent in all distances (A-B-B-C). She also becomes a member of Team Ascella, supporting [[Rhein Kraft (umamusume)|]] and [[Cesario (umamusume)|]] in their races.

title: oguri_cap_(umamusume)
body:
Character from [[Umamusume]].

Nicknamed the "Grey Monster", Oguri Cap is a talented racer with very modest origins, has a strong [[Heartbeat]] and a ravenous appetite. [[oguri_cap_(racehorse)|The actual horse]] is named after his sire: Dancing [i]Cap[/i]. 

Oguri has her own spin-off manga titled [[Umamusume: Cinderella Gray]].

As noted, her most salient trait is her appetite. This is better detailed in the ""Oguri the Gray Munchster":[/pools/17293]" pool page.

body:

title: gold_ship_(umamusume)
body:
[i][[Umamusume]][/i] character.

Gold Ship is the self-proclaimed [[pakatube|PR manager]] of the Umamusume franchise and a [[virtual youtuber]], active since March of 2018. 

As a popular character and her real-life lineage having some "serious implications":[/pools/17253] in the Uma-verse (for one thing, she would be related to the Mejiro family), she is often being portrayed as a [[aged down]] child, usually with her real-life birth color, which is chestnut.

title: tokai_teio_(umamusume)
body:
A character from the [[Umamusume]] mobile game and the main character of the second season of the anime adaptation. A somewhat tomboyish girl who idolizes [[symboli_rudolf_(umamusume)|Symboli Rudolf]]. Notably, her second costume is marching band/military inspired.

Occasionally appears alongside [[symboli_rudolf_(umamusume)|Symboli Rudolf]] in fan arts due to the former being the real-life sire of the race horse she's based on. See the "Dark Side of the Horse":[/pools/17253] pool for more information.

title: mejiro_mcqueen_(umamusume)
body:
Character from [i][[Umamusume]][/i]. A lady from the prestigious Mejiro family, Mejiro McQueen is the resident [i]Ojou-sama[/i] character of the series. While she strives to be as prim and proper as she can, she has to deal with [[Gold Ship (umamusume)|]] antics as well as her own sweet tooth. While she was a supporting character in the first season of the anime, she became the deuteragonist for the second season, sharing the spotlight with [[Tokai Teio (umamusume)|]] and exploring the Mejiro family in more detail. In the mobile game, she is the main character as well as the first member of Team Sirius, after [[Oguri Cap (Umamusume)|]] retired.

title: ikuno_dictus_(umamusume)
body:
Character from [i][[Umamusume]][/i].

The "Iron Lady". While she is originally nicknamed as such for the original horse's long career and unusual sturdiness despite her leg injuries in her youth, this version is nicknamed for taking logistics, her own as well as others, with stone cold seriousness due to said leg injuries. The original horse was named after her sire, Dictus, of whom, his descendants usually inherit his belligerent personality and his distictive leer... [i]usually[/i]. She is part of Team Canopus in the anime, acting as the brains of the team.

title: nice_nature_(umamusume)
body:
[[Umamusume]] character. Nice Nature sees herself as the most normal and sane member of the team but she instead comes off as the most insecure, basically citing the original horse's collection of third places. Personality-wise she is notably seen as an unassuming, unambitious, and laidback character, opting not to be overly expressive in most scenarios. Despite her laidback attitude, she takes racing very seriously. Whether she wins or loses, she doesn't let anything go to her head. Although not often, when she does express herself, she tends to get embarrassed rather easily (usually in front of her [[Trainer (umamusume)|]])

body:
Character from [[Umamusume]].

A bubbly yet surpisingly normal girl with a long name and a cute catchphrase. Due to her clumsiness or poor luck, she often get nosebleeds. "Machitan" is a member of Team Canopus in the anime, being effectively the optimistic klutz of the team. She is also take notes in her efforts to become better.

title: baritone_saxophone
body: The baritone saxophone is a woodwind [[instrument]]. It is the largest and lowest-pitched instrument in the [[saxophone]] family in common use.

title: saxophone
body:
A musical instrument that is popular in jazz, classical, and funk music. Comes in four popular sizes (listed from smallest to largest): soprano, alto, tenor, and baritone. (Smaller and larger variations of the soprano and baritone exist, but they are very rarely used.)

[[alto saxophone|Alto]]: Most commonly used and often in small jazz groups as well as large ensembles. Most distinct feature is that the neck is straight where the mouthpiece is attached. Convenient in size for generally all player heights, standing or sitting. 

 [[tenor saxophone|Tenor]]: Slightly larger with the physical distinction being the curved neck. Second most common and can be just as essential as the alto. 

 [[baritone saxophone|Baritone]]: Largest and with a deep bass-like sound, the neck has a complete loop. The size and the weight is considerably harder to maneuver than the rest. They are less common than the prior two, but can be still seen in large wind ensembles and medium to large jazz groups to provide bass depth.

[[soprano saxophone|Soprano]]: The look and posture it is held is almost exactly like a [[clarinet|clarinet]]. Mostly used as a solo instrument in classical or orchestral environments, or in a saxophone quartet.

title: hasu_no_sora_school_uniform
body:
The uniform of the Hasu no Sora Girls' High School from [[Link! Like! Love Live!]].

The [[winter uniform]] consists of a [[medium dress|medium-length]] [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[pleated dress|pleated]] [[brown dress|brown]] [[sailor dress]] with a [[white sailor collar|white]] [[sailor collar]], a [[neckerchief]] with the color indicating the grade of the student (rotating between [[red neckerchief|red]], [[aqua neckerchief|aqua]], and [[yellow neckerchief|yellow]]) and [[brown shoes|brown]] [[loafers]]. In school, they wear color-coded [[uwabaki]] matching their neckerchief. In especially cold days, students may wear a [[black coat|black]] [[collared coat]] over their uniform. 

The [[summer uniform]] instead features a [[puffy short sleeves|puffy short-sleeved]] [[blue dress|blue-ish]] [[white dress|white]] [[sailor dress]] with a [[breast pocket]] on the wearer's left. 

Note that in live performances, the cast usually wear only the skirt part of the winter uniform along with a themed t-shirt in encores.

Unlike the other entries of Love Live!, they don't change their neckerchiefs to other colors when they move up a class. 

h4. Examples
* !post #7452192: Winter uniform
* !post #7515584: Black collared coat
* !post #7503740: Summer uniform
* !post #8734082: Live shirt example

h4. See also

* [[Otonokizaka school uniform]]
* [[Uranohoshi school uniform]]
* [[Nijigasaki school uniform]]
* [[Yuigaoka school uniform]]
* [[List of Uniforms]]

title: roosterteeth
body:
An American web video production company, famous for [[RWBY]] and [[Red vs Blue|Red vs. Blue]]. From 2014 to 2022, Roosterteeth went from being independently run to finding itself steadily under the ownership of AT&T, before ending up at its final parent company,  [[Warner bros|Warner Bros. Discovery]].

Roosterteeth was shut down by its parent company in 2024. On February 5, 2025, the Roosterteeth brand was bought by former co-founder Burnie Burns under his independent company, Box Canyon Productions. However, some former properties like RWBY will not return due to being sold to other companies.

h4. Works
* [[Camp Camp]]
* [[Gen Lock|gen:LOCK]]
* [[Red vs Blue|Red vs. Blue]]
* [[RWBY]]
* [[Transformers: War for Cybertron Trilogy]]

h4.External links
* "Official website":https://roosterteeth.com/

title: celestial_dragons_(one_piece)
body:
The [b]Celestial Dragons[/b], also known as the [b]World Nobles[/b], are the aristocratic descendants of nineteen of the First Twenty kingdoms who established what is now known as the World Government. Due to their elite status within the World Government, they are serving as the major antagonists of [[One Piece]].

Most of the Celestial Dragons are often seen with an astronaut-like outfit with its own air supply, ostensibly to prevent the "impure" air that the commoner breathe to "contaminate" them.

h4. See also
* [[Gorosei]]

title: carrot_hamburger_steak
body: A dish consisting of at least one [[hamburger steak]] patty, but typically three patties stacked on top of each other, with a [[carrot]] planted deep in the middle. It's an iconic dish of the [i][[Umamusume]][/i] franchise.

title: gorosei
body:
The [b]Gorosei[/b], or the [b]Five Elders[/b], are the group of five elite [[Celestial Dragons (one piece)|]] who co-ruled the World Government. As such, they served as the overarching main antagonists of the [[One Piece]] series.

Each member posses an extremely powerful Mythical [[Devil Fruit]] that allows them to transform into a gigantic monsters. In addition, they are practically immortal, as they are capable of regenerating even when their body were shattered to pieces.

[spoiler]In reality, they are serving under the secretive supreme ruler of the World Government [[Imu (one piece)|]], who granted them immortality. They acts as the "public" face of his authority.[/spoiler]

Only apply this tag if most, if not all members of the Gorosei were present within the image.

h4. Members
* [[Marcus Mars]]
* [[Topman Warcury]]
* [[Ethan-Baron V. Nusjuro]]
* [[Shepherd Ju Peter]]
* [[Jaygarcia Saturn]] [spoiler](killed, replaced by Garling)[/spoiler]
* [[Figarland Garling]]

title: lynn_minmay
body:
A female character from the [[MACROSS]] franchise, originally spelled as Linn Minmei.

She is one of the main characters from [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]] TV series. She also appears in the [[Macross: Do You Remember Love?]] movie, in archival footage and flashbacks in the [[Macross Flashback 2012]] OVA and in the [[Macross: The First]] [[comic]]. 

[b]Lynn Minmay[/b] is a sweet, flighty and insecure teenage pop [[idol]] born in Yokohama Chinatown, Japan (though she is of partial Chinese descent).

In [[real life]] this very popular character was voiced by [[voice actor|voice actress]] "Mari Iijima":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mari_Iijima who became an instant celebrity and began her musical career during the series. 

h4. See also

* [[Ichijou Hikaru]]
* [[Hayase Misa]]

title: sdf-2_megaroad-01
body:
A massive [[spacecraft]] from the [[Macross]] series. It first appeared in the [[Macross Flashback 2012]] OVA from 1987.

The [[U.N. Spacy]] [b]SDF-2 Megaroad-01 Class Super-Long Range Colonization Ship[/b] was originally going to be a bigger and better armed version of the [[SDF-1|SDF-1 Macross]]. However, after the end of [[choujikuu yousai macross|Space War I]] the ship was redesigned as the first of a series of massive colonization craft developed for the program of expansion of human civilization and culture across the [[galaxy]].

The SDF-2 can't transform and was designed with various minimal armaments to ensure more space was available for colonists and bigger life support systems. However, a large complement of [[mecha]], which included several [[destroid]]s and the brand new [[VF-4]] variable fighters, were onboard the new vessel. Also, a defense [[fleet]] composed of many Earth and [[Zentradi]] warships provided escort for the Megaroad. The Megaroad class ships were eventually succeded by the bigger and more advanced [[city 7|City Class Starships]]. 

The SDF-2 Megaroad-01 was designed by [[Miyatake Kazutaka]] in the 1980s.

title: uraga_class_carrier
body:
A fictional [[military]] [[spacecraft]] from the [[MACROSS]] science fiction anime series.

The [b]Uraga Class Escort Battle Carrier[/b] is the next generation stealth carrier built to replace the GuantÃ¡namo Class Stealth Carriers in the Earth's military forces. 

The Uraga Class, built with weaponry, armor and maneuverability comparable to a cruiser, is often used as the flagship of small [[U.N. Spacy]] and [[N.U.N.S.]] fleets. 

At 550 meters long, the Uraga Class ships are much larger conventional spacecraft but still significantly smaller than the [[SDF-1|SDF-1 Macross]] or the later New Macross Class ships. The Uraga is built with a stealth composition superstructure and features a dual deck launching system for [[variable fighter]]s; one deck running the latter dorsal two-thirds of the ship and an internal deck underneath with a launching deck in the forward third. This efficient deck design allows rapid deployment of multiple craft simultaneously and has become common on many UN Spacy carrier vessels.

These ships are rare among colonization fleets due to their high costs compared to the [[ARMD]] carriers but the U.N.G. remains committed to replacing the older ARMD carriers one by one with Uraga Class ships. As more Uraga Class Escort Battle Carriers are built, they are poised to become the mainstay combat and carrier ship for the U.N. Spacy. Many Uraga Class vessels are part of the Earth's defense fleet and are found serving as command ships for large groups of [[Guantanamo Class Stealth Carrier]]s and [[Northampton Class Stealth Frigate]]s. Several Uraga Class Escort Battle Carriers are also in active service as defensive stations docked to unarmed core ships.

In real life this ship was designed by artist [[Miyatake Kazutaka]] in the 90s.

title: macross_scrambled_valkyrie
body:
[b]ChÅ JikÅ« YÅsai Macross: Scrambled Valkyrie[/b] is a 16-megabit, 2D shooter released on the [[Nintendo]] [[Super Famicom]] in 1993 and based on the 1984 animated movie The Super Dimension Fortress [[Macross: Do You Remember Love?]] 

The story takes place after the movie's ending but before the launch of the [[SDF-2 Megaroad-01]]. 

The game was developed by WinkySoft and published by Zamuse. It was only released in Japan.

title: macross_flashback_2012
body:
[b]The Super Dimension Fortress[/b] [[Macross]] [b]Flash Back 2012[/b] is a 1987 OVA collection of music videos from [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]] animated television series (1982-1983) and [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross|: Do You Remember Love?]] theatrical film adaptation (1984). 

It also contains several minutes of new footage (with new [[mecha]], [[spacecraft]] and costume designs) that depicts story events that were initially planned but not animated for the endings of the television series (the launch of the [[SDF-2 Megaroad-01]] colonization ship captained by [[Hayase Misa]]) and the film (the final concert on Earth by [[Lynn Minmay]]).

h4. See also

* [[VF-4]]

The manga which is an adaptation of the light novel, was worked on by Tsubasa Hazuki and launched on the Comic Earth Star manga website in 2017. A TV Anime was announced on August 23, 2024 And set to premiere in October 2025.

"Official Anime site":[https://www.lastboss-anime.com/]

title: brisket
body: A tough but incredibly flavorful cut of beef from the cow's chest. Its toughness is its strength, as it requires low and slow cooking methods to break down the connective tissue, resulting in incredibly tender, juicy, and flavorful meat that is a centerpiece of many cuisines, especially barbecue.

title: matzah
body: A type of unleavened flatbread that holds significant importance in [[Jewish]] tradition, especially during the holiday of [[Passover]] (Pesach).

title: passover
body: A major Jewish festival that commemorates the Biblical story of the Israelitesâ€™ Exodus from slavery in ancient Egypt. This story is recorded in the Hebrew Bibleâ€™s Book of Exodus. The holiday begins on the 15th day of the Hebrew month of Nisan and lasts for seven days in Israel (and among some liberal Jewish communities worldwide), or eight days in many traditional communities outside of Israel.

title: netflix
body:
An American video streaming platform, largely credited with popularizing the streaming format and contributing to the decline of the video rental market in America.

Initially founded as a mail-order DVD rental service, the company is more well known for its popular streaming service and has produced a number of original productions with some of them earning [[academy award of merit|Academy Awards]].

title: saria_(arknights)
body:
[i]Saria, former researcher of Rhine Lab, will serve as a core part of the squad's defense and healing unit on the battlefield.[/i]

A playable Defender Operator in [[Arknights]].

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Columbia[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]April 23[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Vouivre[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]174 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]5 years[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

Saria was once the director of the [[Rhine Lab (arknights)|]] Defense Division, has made contributions to the fields of life science, microbiology, and Originium Arts and has also proven herself formidable when it comes to demolition, protection, and anomaly containment missions. She is currently working with Rhodes Island in various scientific fields and is negotiating a more in-depth cooperation plan with them.

Parted ways with Rhine Lab, LLC after a certain incident involving [[Ifrit (Arknights)|]] and her former colleague, [[Silence (Arknights)|]], with the latter ensuring Saria and Ifrit do not get the chance to interact with each other.

One of the supporting characters in the side story event [i]Mansfield Break[/i]. Uses calcification arts in addition to her healing and defensive capabilities.

Her motif is based on a Western dragon. Her callsign is derived from the mythical name of the "gray-haired mountain" Mount Hermon, located between the border of present-day Syria and Lebanon.

Her [[voice actor]] is [[Iguchi Yuka]].

h4. Skins
* !post #3563856: Default
* !post #3563858: Elite II
* !post #3887634: [[Saria (Stronghold) (arknights)|Stronghold]]
* !post #4256503: [[Saria (The Law) (arknights)|The Law]]

title: silence_(arknights)
body:
[i]Silence, medical specialist of Rhine Lab, will make use of the latest scientific developments on the battlefield.[/i]

A playable Medic Operator in [[Arknights]].

Real Name: Olivia Silence

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Columbia[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]May 18[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Liberi[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]154 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]None[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

An ex-Originium researcher at [[Rhine Lab (Arknights)|Rhine Lab, LLC]]. She was involved in several unknown applied research projects as well as several clinical trials on oripathy there, with [[Ifrit_(Arknights)|Ifrit]] as her test subject. After a horrendous incident at the lab, she left Rhine Lab and took Ifrit into her care and brought her to Rhodes Island, which possessed the only other facilities outside of Rhine Lab capable of containing an Oripathy case as seemingly severe as Ifrit's. She now provides battlefield medical treatments to Rhodes Island.

She deploys medical [[drone|drones]] in battle. Her motif is based on owls, specifically the [i]Great Horned Owl[/i].

Her [[voice actor]] is [[Kitou Akari]].

h4. Skins

title: beagle_(arknights)
body:
[i]Beagle, Defender Operator of Rhodes Island, will provide a solid defense for the squad.[/i]

A playable Defender Operator in [[Arknights]].

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]BolÃ­var[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]March 2[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Perro[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]154cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]1 year[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

The defender of Rhodes Island's Op Reserve Team A1. She used to be a Columbian police cadet, alongside [[Fang (arknights)|]] and [[Kroos (arknights)|]].

Despite her clumsiness and immaturity in some respects, she displays professionalism, resilience and extreme talent. 

She likes to help other R.I. operators and her teammates, such as solving disputes between [[Lava (arknights)|]] and [[Hibiscus (arknights)|]], or helping Fang to find Kroos.

Her [[voice actor]]s are Nana Harumura (JP), Wang Xiaotong (CN), Claire Morgan (EN) and Lee Hyun-jin (KR). Her illustrator is [[Xiayehongming]].

body:
[i]Shaw, officer of the Lungmen Fire Department, will provide various means of tactical support for everyone.[/i]

A playable Specialist Operator in [[Arknights]].

h4. Profile

A fast-talking firefighter of the Lungmen Fire Departement. She has adapted firefighting skills to actual combat, providing a variety of new tactical options to Rhodes Island. Currently a member of a special ops squad, she offers expertise in firefighting and safety. She uses a fire axe and water hose as her weapons of choice.

Her motif is based on squirrels.

Her [[voice actor]] is [[Hirohashi Ryou]].

title: tyson_hesse
body:
American illustrator, comic artist, and animator, known for his prolific artistic contributions to official [i][[Sonic (series)|Sonic the Hedgehog]][/i] media. Created a [i]Sonic[/i] fan comic, titled [i]Sonic's Big Fat Adventure[/i], which earned him a position as an artist for the official [i]Sonic[/i] [[sonic the hedgehog (archie comics)|comic series]] published by Archie Comics. Has since served as artist and animation director for several [i]Sonic[/i] cartoon shorts, and became the character design lead for the [[Sonic (live action)|live-action]] film series following the negative reception to the [[Ugly Sonic|initial design]] of the first film's version of [[Sonic the Hedgehog|Sonic]].

* "Wikipedia article":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tyson_Hesse]

title: multiple_persona
body: Similar to [[dual persona]], except that there at least three personas of the same character involved. Take note that the [[solo]] tag, or singular people counters ([[1boy]], [[1girl]], [[1other]]) should [b]not[/b] be used with this tag. If the instances of the character are identical, use [[clone]] instead. Also see [[time paradox]] and [[multiple expressions]]. Do not use the tag for [[reference sheet]], [[variations]] and other depictions of the same character from different points of view (unless those are really different persona as in post #1173905). h4. See also * [[selfcest]] * [[clone harem]] * [[time paradox]]

title: sand_seal_(zelda)
body: Creatures from [[The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild]] and [[The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom]]. Used by the [[Gerudo]] as transport through the desert, they look like [[walrus|walruses]] with a mane which resembles a [[mohawk]].

body:

title: hatterene
body:
[b]Hatterene[/b] (Japanese: [b]ãƒ–ãƒªãƒ ã‚ªãƒ³[/b] Brimuon) is a dual-type Psychic/Fairy [[pokemon (creature)|PokÃ©mon]] introduced in Generation VIII. It evolves from [[Hattrem]]. It is the final form of [[Hatenna]].

Much like [[Gardevoir]], it gained similar popularity due to its humanoid, feminine appearance, resembling a [[witch]] with a [[witch hat]]. Though unlike the former, Hatterene is exclusively female. Because of the similar notoriety, it is also often paired with Gardevoir, typically as a rival.

In some fanarts, Hatterene's "dress" (in actuality an extension to its "hair" appendages) is mistakenly depicted as the body of the PokÃ©mon itself. The "actual" body of Hatterene is in fact disproportionally small, and can be visible above the "dress".

Hatterene has a [[Gigantamax]] form, [[Gigantamax Hatterene]].

h4. External links

* "Bulbapedia: Hatterene (PokÃ©mon)":[https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Hatterene_(Pok%C3%A9mon)]

title: hiei_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese battleship [i]Hiei[/i]. Character design by [[Konishi (koconatu)|]], voiced by [[Touyama Nao]].

She has [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] [[flipped hair|flipped back]], and [[purple eyes]]. All of the Kongou-class wear a [[nontraditional miko]] uniform with differently colored [[skirt]]s (hers is [[green skirt|green]]), [[thigh boots]], and wear the same signature winged [[hairband]].

She tends to be depicted as a fiery airhead girl who usually can be seen worshiping [[Kongou (kancolle)|]], her big sister. This leads to her frequently being portrayed as a lesbian, siscon, and at odds with the [[Admiral (kancolle)|]], either being indifferent to his presence or holding a deep, perhaps one sided rivalry with him due to her sister's unrelenting admiral love.

Her "{{pool:13812|Hiei Curry}}" featured in her hourlies, whether it is good or [[bad food|bad]] (usually the latter), is infamous for making the admiral run away for several hours. Oftentimes, her cooking is plain [[censored food]]. Has a tendency to yell out "Hieee-!" (written "ã²ãˆãƒ¼ï¼" or with a typographical variant), which sounds like her own name.

title: hellbender
body:
A species of [[giant salamander|giant]] [[salamander]] found in the eastern and central [[United States]].

They have flat bodies and heads, with beady dorsal eyes and slimy skin. They are blotchy brown or red-brown in color, with a paler underbelly.

title: salamander
body:
A common name for amphibians of the order Urodela. They are typically characterized by their slender bodies, short noses, and long tails.

In legend, they were associated with fire and several ancient writers believed they were born from fire or could consume or otherwise extinguish it with the cold(-blooded) bodies. Many fantastic works use them as a kind of fire elemental.

title: kamen_rider_zx
body:
The tenth [[Kamen Rider]] introduced during an anniversary TV special. His name is pronounced as "Zee-Cross".

After being abducted when his plane crashes, Ryou Murasame is made into the Badan Empire's agent of evil known as ZX until he suffers an accident that undoes his brainwashing. He escapes from Badan, encountering senior Riders. He is reluctant to trust them at first, but eventually joins them to destroy the Badan Empire, giving himself the name of Kamen Rider ZX.

ZX is based on a long-horn beetle and mostly colored red and white with a green scarf.

h4. See also

* [[Kamen Rider Spirits]]

h4. External links

* Special officially streaming on YouTube: "Subbed":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Tc7CH1-5FpQ]

title: skyrider
body:
Protagonist of the sixth entry in the [[Kamen Rider]] franchise, [[New Kamen Rider]].

Hiroshi Tsukuba is severely wounded by a mutant monster of the organization Neo-Shocker. A kidnapped scientist convinces his captors that he can make Tsukuba of use to them by surgically altering him into their cyborg slave. With the intention of turning against Neo-Shocker, the scientist uses this chance to save Tsukuba's life, turning him into Kamen Rider.

Later he is given the name "Skyrider" by his predecessors to avoid confusion with [[kamen_rider_1|No. 1]] and [[kamen_rider_2|No. 2]].

Skyrider is mostly bright green in color with a brown chestplate and the first rider capable of flight.

body:

She has [[short_hair|short]] [[black hair|black]] [[bob cut]] and [[brown eyes]], with her [[hair ornament]] patterned off her real-life mainmast. She wears the [i]Myoukou[/i]-class purple [[military uniform]] with a [[black skirt|black]] [[pencil skirt]], white [[pantyhose]] and [[white gloves|white]] [[elbow gloves]].

She is the scaredy-cat of her class, often saying "I'm sorry". Her second remodel gives her enough self-confidence to be able to do something without apologizing and fight at her full potential.

title: psylocke
body:
An [[X-Men]] character with the powers of [[telepathy]] and [[telekinesis]].

The first Psylocke was Elizabeth "Betsy" Braddock, a British woman who was the twin sister of Brian Braddock, aka [[Captain Britain]]. When Betsy was captured by the Mandarin, she ended switching bodies with a Japanese ninja mutant named Kwannon, which Betsy continue to use her codename Psylocke in her new Japanese body over 29 years. Eventually both Betsy and Kwannon switch back to their original bodies with Betsy becoming the new Captain Britain while Kwannon becomes the second Psylocke.

A third Psylocke was introduced in Marvel's 2021 Demon Days mini comic series set in a Marvel universe that merged with Japanese mythology. This version of Psylocke is named Sai, a wandering [[Samurai]] who hunts [[traditional youkai|Yokai]] with her psionic powers. The Psylocke Sai would later appear in the video game [[Marvel Rivals]].

As a result of her confusing backstory, Psylocke is either portrayed as British, Japanese or British Asian in other media.

In film, she appears in [[X-Men: The Last Stand]] and [[X-Men: Apocalypse]] in the [[X-Men film series]]. In videogames, she appears in the [[Marvel vs. Capcom]] series and in [[Marvel Rivals]].

h4. Appearance

title: kamen_rider
body:
[b]Kamen Rider[/b] (ä»®é¢ãƒ©ã‚¤ãƒ€ãƒ¼), also known as Masked Rider, is a Japanese [[tokusatsu]] franchise created by [[Ishinomori Shoutarou]].

The plot generally involves at least one main character who possesses the ability to transform and does battle with monsters and organizations that are somehow related to his origin.

Riders are typically identified by their insect-like features such as their compound eyes and antenna. Other visual cues include intricate belts, motorcycles, [[henshin]] poses, scarves, and the signature finisher, the Rider Kick.

title: euphemism
body:
When an offensive, harsh or blunt expression is replaced with a mild, indirect or vague one. 

Visual euphemisms exist, too, such as the one used for [[Akiyama Mio]]'s accidental [[pantyshot]] in the [[K-On!]] anime (a stripped bowl of rice) or when [[swastika]] or the [[hammer and sickle]] are replaced with more innocuous symbols to avoid offending the audience and/or so the work won't run afoul of laws banning the public display of either symbols.

An orthographic euphemism is spelling a word deliberately wrong (e.g. "porn" becomes "pr0n", "n0rp" or "prawn") to circumvent censorship algorithms on the usenet, websites, social media apps, etc.

h4. Examples

* !post #8019284

h4. See also

* [[double entendre]]
* [[pun]]

h4. External links

* "TVTropes: Unusual Euphemisms":[http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UnusualEuphemism]

title: murasame_(kancolle)
body:
The personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Murasame[/i] in [[Kantai Collection]]. Character design by [[Kujou Ichiso]], voiced by [[Tanibe Yumi]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[light brown hair]] in [[twintails]], and [[brown eyes]]. Her default outfit is the [i]Shiratsuyu[/i]-class' [[school uniform]]: a [[black_serafuku|black]] [[serafuku]], [[black socks]], and brown [[loafers]].

Her [[rigging]] at base form consists of her funnel to her back, a 12.7 cm twin gun mount slung to the side, and two 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]] on [[thigh strap]]s. Unlike the rest of her class however, she wields a melee weapon, that being a chained anchor that she utilizes as a [[flail]].

She has a very girly personality while being the most physically mature person among her sister ships. Has a habit of beginning her sentences with "hai hai" (ã¯ã„ã¯ãƒ¼ã„).

title: graph
body:
A graph is a visualization of numerical data. Examples include line graphs, scatter plots, [[bar chart]]s, [[radar chart]]s, [[pie chart]]s etc.

When a graph makes use of two or three axis at right angles to one another (often with a [[grid]]), it is a [[Cartesian chart]].  Line graphs and scatter plots are examples of these.

Not to be confused with [[chart]], which is generally for comparison charts between characters.

h4. Examples

* !post #8619592: [[Bar chart]]
* !post #2544513: [[Pie chart]]

h4. See also

* [[chart]]
* [[diagram]]

body:

title: dotsuitare_hompo
body:
A three member unit in [[Hypnosis Mic]] that represents the Osaka division. It consists of the members [[Nurude Sasara]] (a comedian), [[Amayado Rei]] (a conman whose true identity is [spoilers]the father of the [[buster_bros!!!|Yamada brothers]] and the inventor of the Hypnosis Mic technology[/spoilers]), and [[Tsutsujimori Rosho]] (a teacher).

Sometimes referred to as Dotsuitare [i]Honpo[/i].

title: buster_bros!!!
body: A three member unit in [[Hypnosis Mic]] that represents the Ikebukuro division. It consists of the [[brothers]] [[Yamada Ichiro]], [[Yamada Jiro]], and [[Yamada Saburo]].

title: halfling
body:
A humanoid race found in a number of [[fantasy]] settings, most notably [[Dungeons & Dragons]]. They're physically similar to humans, except about half as tall and not as stocky as the similarly sized [[dwarf|dwarves]]. They tend to be portrayed as stealthy and lucky.

Their general description and traits are typically derived from the hobbit race found in [[Tolkien's Legendarium]].

h4. See also

* [[Dwarf]]
* [[Elf]]
* [[Gnome]]
* [[Orc]]
* [[Tag Group:Legendary Creatures]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Halfling":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Halfling

title: dwarf
body:
A fantasy race of short, stocky humanoids. Classically depicted as resembling tiny old men, generally bearded. They are commonly associated with metalwork and mining.

Only apply this tag if the character depicted features the defining characteristics of a dwarf, such as significantly short stature (typically around child's height), bulky build relative to the height, etc.

h4. See also

* [[draph]]
* [[gnome]]
* [[halfling]]
* [[Tag Group:Legendary Creatures]]

title: sharpnelsound
body: The record label/doujin circle of DJ Sharpnel, a [[j-core]] duo. Their logo is a yellow S with a blue outline.

title: j-core
body:
Japanese hardcore techno scene associated with doujin music and rhythm games. Pioneered in the late 90s and early 2000s by duo [[sharpnelsound|DJ Sharpnel]], derived from the earlier [[Nerdcore Techno]] genre that J-core would come to overshadow. Today, J-core is popular around the world due to its use in games and online.

This tag should be used on posts that reference j-core artists, circles, songs or albums.

h4. See also

* [[Camellia (musician)|]]
* [[hardcore tano c|HARDCORE TANO*C]]
* [[t+pazolite]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: J-core":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J-core

title: vip_sensei_(meme)
body:
A Japanese [[meme]] based on a video of the [[Maschinenmensch]] from [[Metropolis (Fritz Lang)|]] dancing to a remix of a [[Super Mario RPG]] song. The video was originally posted by a Spanish blogger in 2005, before it caught the attention of VIPPERs from [[2channel]], who misheard the lyric "drives some peeps insane" as "VIP sensei".

h4. External links

* "Know Your Meme: VIP Teacher":https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/vip-teacher

title: pain_elemental
body:
Floating [[demon]]s from [[DOOM (series)|]] with an appearance and shape similar to [[Cacodemon]]s. Brown, [[one-eyed]], [[sharp teeth]] and distinguished with having [[red sclera]] and arms. They infinitely throw [[Lost soul (doom)|]]s at the player as long as the player is in sight. Uniquely lacks a corpse when killed in [[Doom II]], and cannot be resurrected by [[Arch-vile]]s.

In [[Doom 64]], their appearance changes rather drastically but functions the exact same.

title: doom_ii
body:
Sequel to the first [[DOOM I|DOOM]]. [[Doomguy]] fights off the invading demons on Earth, and ends it by defeating the [[Icon of Sin]]. The game features no changes from the first- but has new enemies and introduces the [[double-barreled shotgun|super shotgun]] to the player's arsenal. Most .wads utilize this version of Doom.

title: doom_(series)
body:
[b]Doom[/b] (stylized as [b]DOOM[/b] or [b]DooM[/b]) is a franchise of first-person shooter [[video game]]s developed by [[id Software]], and related novels, comics, board game, and film adaptations. 

The series focuses on the exploits of an [[Doomguy|unnamed space marine]] operating under the auspices of the Union Aerospace Corporation (U.A.C.), who fights hordes of [[demon]]s and the [[undead]] in order to survive.

body: Japanese electronic music movement from doujin communities in the early 90s. The genre was the basis for the later [[J-core]] genre. This tag should be used when a post references nerdcore techno artists, circles, or albums.

title: gaki_kyonyuu
body:
An [[original]] series by [[kaedeko_(kaedelic)|Kaedeko]]. Translated as "Big-Breasted Brats".

* [[sasaki kanna|Sasaki Kanna]]
* [[sasaki miyuki|Sasaki Miyuki]]

title: sasaki_kanna
body:
An [[original|original character]] in the [[Gaki Kyonyuu]] series by [[kaedeko_(kaedelic)|Kaedeko]].

She's an elementary school student often described as [[oppai_loli|big breasted kid]]. She has [[short_hair|short]] [[black hair]] styled in [[twintails]], [[red eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. She is seen mostly wearing either a [[yellow camisole]] or [[crop top]] and [[shorts]]. Her older sister is [[Sasaki Miyuki]], her mother is [[Sasaki Kei]] and she is classmates with [[Lady Flat Chest (gaki Kyonyuu)|]].

title: lady_flat_chest_(gaki_kyonyuu)
body:
An [[original|original character]] in the [[Gaki Kyonyuu]] series by [[kaedeko_(kaedelic)|Kaedeko]].

Introduced in post #4444608. She has [[yellow eyes]], [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] stylized with [[hair over one eye]], and a [[flat chest]].

Her [[serafuku]] [[school uniform]] consists of a [[blue sailor collar|blue]] [[sailor collar]], [[black neckerchief|black]] [[neckerchief]], a [[blue skirt|blue]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[suspender_skirt|suspenders]] [[skirt]], and [[white legwear|white]] [[pantyhose]].

She is classmates with [[Sasaki Kanna]].

title: sasaki_miyuki
body:
An [[original|original character]] in the [[Gaki Kyonyuu]] series by [[kaedeko_(kaedelic)|Kaedeko]].

She has [[long_hair|long]] [[black hair]] held in a [[side ponytail]] with sidelocks, [[purple eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. Her younger sister is [[Sasaki Kanna]] and her mother is [[Sasaki Kei]].

title: sasaki_kei
body:
An [[original|original character]] in the [[Gaki Kyonyuu]] series by [[Kaedeko_(kaedelic)|]].

She is the 36-year-old mother of [[Sasaki Kanna]] and [[Sasaki Miyuki]].

title: cutter_(arknights)
body:
[i]Cutter, mercenary, will complete all tasks on the battlefield in a calm and disciplined manner.[/i]

A playable Guard Operator in [[Arknights]].

h4. Profile

[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Columbia[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]May 2[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Vulpo[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]155 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]3 years[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

Cutter, a mercenary who has long been active in the fringes of Columbiaâ€™s controlled territories, has come seeking medical treatment. She has shown excellent close-quarters combat capabilities across several operations. She currently serves in one of Rhodes Islandâ€™s Guard squads, having participated in many VIP escort jobs among others.

She has [[red eyes]], short [[grey hair]], and has [[bandaid|bandaids]] to cover cuts on her body. She wears a [[sleeveless shirt|red sleeveless shirt]], a [[black jacket]] on her shoulders and a [[black skirt]]. Her motif is based on the red fox, and she has [[fox ears]] and a [[fox tail]]. 

Her voice actors are [[Yahagi Sayuri]] (JP), Su Wan (CN), Kristen Li (EN) and Esther Won (KR). Her original art designer is [[xiayehongming]], while her [b]Wiping Knife[/b] outfit is drawn by [[baimudafeiyu]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #3873394: Default
* !post #3873397: Elite II
* !post #8624111: [[cutter (wiping knife) (arknights)|Wiping Knife]]

His [[voice actor]]s are Bito Taiki (JP), Ma Chengwei (CN), Harry McEntire (EN) and Kim Yoon-gi (KR). His illustrator is [[baimudafeiyu]].

title: nightmare_(arknights)
body:
[i]Nightmare, Caster Operator of Rhodes Island, will provide help with her Originium Arts, no matter which personality is in at the moment. [/i]

A playable Caster Operator in [[Arknights]].

Real Name: Gloria Rebel Pasbelletti

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Victoria[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]June 1[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Feline[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]156 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]6 months[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

Before her induction into Rhodes Island, she was a college student with two specialties: advanced medical Arts and intervention counseling. Skilled in both medical and combat Arts, she currently works in Rhodes Island's triage section while receiving treatment for her mid-stage Oripathy.

She is on friendly terms with [[Perfumer (Arknights)|]] who regularly assists with her rehabilitation.

Her motif is based on cats. Her callsign is the alter ego that manifests within her, caused by Oripathy. Because of it, she insists to be called by her real name instead.

Her [[voice actor]]s are [[Takahashi Rie]] (JP), Zhang Hong (CN), Triya Leong (EN) and Lee Sae-ah (KR). Her original art designer is [[Lpip]], while her second outfit is drawn by [[Studio Montagne]].

h4. Appearance
* !post #3563890: Default
* !post #3563891: Elite II
* !post #3979905: [[Nightmare (Light and Shadow) (Arknights)|Light and Shadow]]
* !post #8838181: [[nightmare_(the_ferry_girl)_(arknights)|The Ferry Girl]]

title: ibrahim_(nijisanji)
body:
A [[Nijisanji]] [[virtual YouTuber|VTuber]]. Designed by [[TakeruNamito]].

He is portrayed with [[dark skin]], silvery-[[white hair]], and [[blue eyes|bluish]]-[[green eyes]].

His attire is in a traditional [[Indonesian clothes|Indonesian style]], consisting of a [[white shirt]] with [[gold trim]] on the V-neck, a gold-trimmed [[black vest]] with circular [[jewelry]] of gold and silver, black [[choker]], golden [[vambraces]], golden [[earrings]], a black [[sash]], and [[white pants]].

h4. Costumes

title: kanda_shouichi
body:
A [[Nijisanji]] [[virtual YouTuber]], designed by [[Hirai Yuzuki]].

He has [[blonde hair]] and almost always keeps his eyes closed, only opening them slightly ever so often. His default outfit is a [[white shirt]] and a [[black jacket]] [[hoodie]], though he may also be portrayed with [[glasses]].

title: dino_(google_chrome)
body:
The retro, monochromatic [[pixel art|pixel]] T. rex dinosaur that appears on an error page in [[Google Chrome]] when unable to connect to the Internet, allowing you to play an infinite runnner game while disconnected. It's often grey, flat, and running across barren ground with cacti in the background.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Dinosaur Game":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dinosaur_Game]

title: jowol
body:
An English babiniku [[indie virtual youtuber|Indie]] [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]]. He was originally a human man, though his soul now possesses a female [[doll]] who has either [[pink hair|pink]] or [[white hair]] and [[red eyes]]. He also has [[cracked skin]], [[doll joints]], and a [[torn dress|torn]] [[victorian]] dress.

title: buneary
body:
[[pokemon|PokÃ©mon]] #427 in the National PokÃ©Dex.
Buneary is a small, bipedal, rabbit-like PokÃ©mon with brown ears that can curl up. It has two types of fur covering its body: a light tan fleece that covers much of its lower body, feet, and the tips of its ears, and a smooth chocolate colored pelt on the upper half of its body. 

It evolves into [[Lopunny]] with high [i]friendship[/i] towards the trainer.

Type: Normal
Abilities: Run Away / Klutz (Hidden: Limber)
Height: 40 cm / 1'4"
Weight: 5.5 kg / 12.1 lbs

Japanese Name: [b]Mimirol[/b]

Prior PokÃ©mon: [[Drifblim]]
Next PokÃ©mon: [[Lopunny]]

h4. External Links

* "Bulbapedia: Buneary (PokÃ©mon)":[https://m.bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Buneary_(Pok%C3%A9mon)]

title: volcarona
body:
[[pokemon|PokÃ©mon]] #637 in the National PokÃ©Dex.
Volcarona is a large, moth-like PokÃ©mon with four small feet. It appears to have compound eyes that are two shades of blue, and there is a red horn-like structure on each side of its face. The fuzz on its upper body is smoky white and tangled. Its abdomen is black in the center and light blue with black dots on the outside. It has six leaf-like wings that are orange in color and have small black spots.
Its signature move is [i]Fiery Dance[/i].

Type: Bug/Fire
Abilities: Flame Body (Hidden: Swarm)
Height: 160 cm / 5'3"
Weight: 46 kg / 101.4 lbs

It evolves from [[Larvesta]] starting at level 59.
Japanese Name: [b]Ulgamoth[/b]

Prior PokÃ©mon: [[Larvesta]]
Next PokÃ©mom: [[Cobalion]]

title: hisuian_typhlosion
body:
Introduced in [[pokemon legends: arceus|PokÃ©mon Legends: Arceus]] as the Hisuian form of [[Typhlosion]].

Notably more docile than its original Johtonian counterpart, though can still be angered and unleash its 108 ghost flames that builds around its neck.

Type: Fire/Ghost
Abilities: Blaze (Hidden: Frisk)
Height: 160 cm / 5'3"
Weight: 69.8 kg / 153.9 lbs

title: intrepid_kai_(kancolle)
body:
The Kai remodel of [[Intrepid (Kancolle)]]. Changes from her base model are her [[rifle]] and shirt tie gain a camoflage scheme, while her rigging changes color from blue to grey, gains more radars, and her flight deck has white lines painted on it.

title: starlight_academy_school_uniform
body:
The [[school uniform]] worn by students of the Starlight Academy (ã‚¹ã‚¿ãƒ¼ãƒ©ã‚¤ãƒˆå­¦åœ’) in [[Aikatsu!]].

The [[winter uniform]] consists of a [[white shirt]], a [[red ribbon|red]] [[neck ribbon]], a [[blue jacket]], a [[white skirt|white]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]] with a blue [[single stripe]] on it, and [[White footwear|white]] [[high heel boots|high heel]] [[knee boots]].

The [[summer uniform]] is a [[serafuku]] that consists of a [[white shirt|white]] [[shirt]], a [[white sailor collar|white]] [[sailor collar]], a [[red ribbon|red]] [[neck ribbon]], a [[blue skirt|blue]] [[pleated skirt]] with a white [[single stripe]] on it, [[White legwear|white]] [[socks]], and [[Black footwear|black]] [[loafers]].

title: ichijou_ririka_(1st_costume)
body:
The default costume of [[hololive DEV_IS]]'s [[Ichijou Ririka]]. 

She wears a [[white jacket|white]] [[fur jacket]] worn over a [[pink shirt|pink]] [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[blouse]] with [[center frills]] (which is [[shirt tucked in|tucked in]]), a [[purple skirt|purple]] [[pencil skirt|pencil]] [[miniskirt]], and a pair of [[black footwear|black]] [[high heel boots]]. Her accessories include  a [[white belt]], a [[thigh strap]], a [[gold choker]], a [[wristwatch]], and a pair of [[sunglasses]] [[eyewear_on_head|on top of her head]].

h4. Appearance

title: vienna_(vtuber)_(1st_costume)
body:
The original costume of the [[indie virtual youtuber|Indie]] [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]] [[Vienna (vtuber)|]].

It consists of a [[crop top|cropped]] [[white camisole]] and [[white pants]] with a [[black jacket|black]] [[fur-trimmed jacket]] worn [[off shoulder]], a [[detached collar]], and a pair of [[black footwear|black]] [[boots]]. In this look, Vienna has [[very long hair]] loose hair.

She later received an update to this costume, that gave her the option to replace the original jacket with a [[red jacket|red]] [[hooded jacket]] and switch her hairstyle to [[twintails]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #5370145: Profile
* !post #5315416: Reference sheet

body:
[i]Longcat is looooooong.[/i]

An exceptionally long, female [[white cat]] that became an internet [[meme]]. The original photo features her owner [[holding animal|holding her]] in an [[armpit carry]], demonstrating her length.

Her real name was Shiro (ã‚·ãƒ­, lit. "White"), a stray cat found in the streets and adopted by her human. On [[2channel]], she was known as Nobiiru (ã®ã³ãƒ¼ã‚‹, from [i]nobiru[/i], which means to stretch or extend). On [[4chan]] and the western Internet, she was known as Longcat.

She died on "September 20, 2020.":[https://twitter.com/aerosubaru/status/1307553093681209345] ("Archive of Tweet":https://web.archive.org/web/20200920053331/https://twitter.com/aerosubaru/status/1307553093681209345)

h4. Examples

* !asset #22729844: Origin

h4. See also

* [[Tacgnol]], a long black cat, evil version of Longcat

h4. External links

* "Know Your Meme: Longcat":https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/longcat

title: nijiyon
body:
A spinoff of [[Love Live! Nijigasaki High School Idol Club]] that started out as a [[4koma]] series drawn by [[Miyako Hito]].

Season 1 spans chapters 1 to 60 and can be found at the [[Love Live! School Idol Festival ALL STARS]] website.

Season 2 continues the series up to chapter 110 and can be found at the [[Dengeki G's]] website.

Season 3, unlike the previous seasons, is a motion comic with background music and voice acting. It ran every Tuesday from June 2, 2020 to December 29, 2020 on the official YouTube channel.

Season 4 continues from Season 3 and introduces [[mifune shioriko|Shioriko]], [[mia taylor|Mia]], and [[zhong lanzhu|Lanzhu]] to the cast. It ran from July 6, 2021 to January 18, 2022 on the official YouTube channel.

An anime based on the series called Nijiyon Animation premiered on January 6, 2023. A second season has started airing on April 5, 2024.

Use this tag when the post references events that have happened in the series.

h4. See also
* pool #24042: Nijiyon Plus

h4. External Links

* "Season 1":[https://lovelive-as.bushimo.jp/comic/]
* "Season 2":[http://gs.dengeki.com/web_rensai/niziyon/]
* "Season 3":[https://youtube.com/playlist?list=PLYpy4kJmEo77AEmJnFbKONWZu_vVz0I7Q]
* "Season 4":[https://youtube.com/playlist?list=PLYpy4kJmEo75Z4kuXQy-e5fFmCoMPRlyE]

title: ruqun
body:
Ruqun (è¥¦è£™) is a set of attire in [[hanfu]] which consists of a short [[jacket]] worn under a [[long skirt]].

An [[aoqun]] is the opposite; hanfu where the top is worn over the skirt (not tucked in). 

Ruqun is however a very broad term, an umbrella term for any kind of hanfu wherein the top is tucked into the skirt. Try to use one of the more specific terms below.  Use [[ruqun]] when none of the below categories apply.

title: callie_(octo_idol_outfit)_(splatoon)
body:
[[Official alternate costume]] attributed to [[Callie (splatoon)|]] from the [[Splatoon (series)|]] series. It was introduced in [[Splatoon 2]].

This outfit is designed like a rebellious inversion of Callie's classic [[callie_(squid_sisters_outfit)_(splatoon)|Squid Sisters]] outfit. Where her usual ika-somen hair ornament has been replaced by a cut, magenta-colored octopus tentacle and her earrings have been swapped out in favor of golden octopus sausages. Her eyes are now also usually covered by DJ Octavio's hypnoshades, a pair of animated sunglasses used to keep her under his influence. 

She wears a black leather crop top with padded shoulders, a built-in spiked collar, a zipper on the back and three vertical pink cut-like stripes on the front. Her midriff is exposed and decorated with a pink octopus-shaped tattoo to the left of her navel, and she's also begun sporting black leather low-cut shorts with built-in spiked studs around the waistband, along with what appears to be pink underpants that can be seen peeking up above the shorts. 

She also wears dark purple tights covered in magenta sequins across the rest of her legs, while on her feet are black stiletto-heeled boots with pink soles an pink buckles positioned on the outside of each ankle, the design of the buckles themselves appear to simultaneously resemble that of an octopus and an one-eyed skull. 

h4. Appearance

* !post #8827502

h4. Common community nicknames
h5. Japanese
* [i]Takori-Chan[/i] - A combination of [i]Tako[/i] (meaning "Octopus") and [i]"Aori"[i], being Callie's Japanese name.
* [i]TakoochiAori[/i] - Meaning [i]"Octopus fallen Callie"[/i].

h5. English
* [i]Octo Callie[/i] - Referring to her current allegiance while she's wearing the outfit.
* [i]Hypno Callie / Brainwashed Callie[/i] - Referring to how she's not entirely herself while wearing the outfit (or at least the shades).
* [i]Evil Callie / Boss Callie[/i] - Simply referring to her current role in the game's narrative.

title: sokutai
body:
Japanese court apparel worn by courtiers, aristocrats, and the Japanese emperor during the Heian period. Though no longer worn as everyday clothing, the outfit is still used for especially formal occasions such as weddings and enthronement ceremonies. Not to be confused with [[kariginu]].

The outfit consists of several parts, most notably the [i]kanmuri[/i] ([[tate eboshi]]), [i]hou[/i] (an outer [[robe]]), and [i]shaku[/i] (a [[ritual baton]]).

title: irene_(arknights)
body:
[i]Inquisition Messenger Irene, fighting to protect Iberia's coastline.[/i]

A playable Guard Operator in [[Arknights]].

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Iberia[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]January 3[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Liberi[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]156 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]5 years[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

A novice Iberian Inquisitor and student of High Inquisitor Dario.
After the 'Stultifera Navis' Incident, she resign from inquisitor and join Rhodes Island as an Inquisition Messenger.

She debuted as NPC in the side story event [i]Under Tides[/i], and became playable in the side story event [i]Stultifera Navis.[/i]

Her motif is based on Leach's storm petrel.

Her [[voice actor]]s are [[Kugimiya Rie]] (Japanese), Liu Wen (Chinese), Lizzie Waterworth (English), and San Moon-young (Korean). Her art designer is [[azling]].

body:
Academy City's 2nd Ranked Level 5 esper from [[Toaru Majutsu no Index]]. His ability is known as [[Dark Matter (kakine teitoku)|]] (æœªå…ƒç‰©è³ª, Migen Busshitsu lit. "Unknown Matter"). He often uses his powers to construct six large feathered [[white wings]] made of Dark Matter, giving him an [[angel wings|angel]]-like appearance, ironic considering he's arguably the most evil of all the Level 5s.

He has [[medium hair|medium length]] [[brown hair]] with [[bangs]] and [[brown eyes]], and usually wears a [[purple suit|purple]] / [[brown suit|brownish]] [[suit]] with [[pants]] and a [[jacket]] over an [[open shirt|open]] [[white shirt|white]] [[dress shirt|dress]] [[shirt]] over a [[red sweater|red]] [[sweater]] and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[shoes]]. He usually sports a [[expressionless|cool, stoic]], facial expression.

During the events of [[Toaru Majutsu no Index: New Testament]], Teitoku is defeated by a rogue beetle he created, which then proceeds to take over his appearance and powers, but is now a benevolent and kind person.

title: dark_matter_(kakine_teitoku)
body:
The white matter that [[Kakine Teitoku]] produces as a result of his ability.

Typically used to create his [[wings]].

title: warfarin_(arknights)
body:
[i]Warfarin, Medic Operator of Rhodes Island, sees the safety of her fellow Operators as her duty.[/i]

A playable Medic Operator in [[Arknights]].

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Kazdel[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]June 27[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Sarkaz[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]157 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]10 years[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

A senior figure in the Rhodes Island leadership, She is the founder and administrator of the Rhodes Island Blood Bank, and very accomplished in the medical field. She laid the foundation of the island's medical system with Dr. [[Kal'tsit (arknights)|]].

Ironically, her motif is based on vampires. Her callsign is named after the drug that reduces blood clots in veins or arteries.

Her [[voice actor]] is [[Iwami Manaka]].

title: sheathed_cut
body:
Someone cutting something so quickly that their [[sword]] appears to stay [[sheathed]]. Most commonly seen in combination with a [[battoujutsu stance]].
