title: iaidou
body:
A school of Japanese swordsmanship that emphasizes quickly drawing one's sword and responding to sudden attacks, as well as constant awareness. It developed from iaijutsu, a quick-draw sword technique. The technique is most commonly depicted as quickly drawing, slashing, and sheathing a sword in one smooth motion.

h4. Examples

* !post #2239924
* !post #6175386

h4. See also

* [[battoujutsu stance]]
* [[ready to draw]]
* [[sheathed cut]]

h4. External Links
* "Iaidou (Wikipedia)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iaido]
* "Iaijutsu (Wikipedia)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iaijutsu]

title: battoujutsu_stance
body:
A stance in which a swordfighter is preparing to unsheathe their blade as the first step of an upward slicing attack. The drawing hand may be [[hand on hilt|on the hilt]] of the sword or waiting slightly apart from it while the other hand holds the saya at an angle suitable for the draw.

Battoujutsu's fast draw is a signature technique of [[Himura Kenshin]].

Also use [[sheathed cut]] when an actual cutting is taking place.

h4. Examples

* !post #759893

title: nakasu_kasumi
body:
A character in [[Love Live! Nijigasaki High School Idol Club]]. She's very competitive and always wants to be number one in any competition. Despite her cute appearance and childlike mannerisms, Kasumi spends a lot of her time scheming or thinking up new ways to ensure her own victory.

She has [[red eyes]] and [[short hair|short]], [[grey hair|grey]]-[[brown hair]] in a [[bob cut]] with [[asymmetrical hair|one side slightly longer than the other]] and a [[crescent hair ornament|crescent-shaped]] [[hairclip]]. She wears a [[yellow sweater|yellow]] [[sweater]] under her blazer with the winter uniform and a custom [[argyle sweater vest]] for her summer uniform in ALL STARS. In the anime, she wears a simple [[sweater vest]].

She is a member of [[QU4RTZ (love live!)|]].

Voiced by [[Sagara Mayu]].

title: chastity_cage
body:
A device that can be locked onto a person's [[penis]] to prevent the wearer from engaging in sexual contact. In many cases, it also makes erection uncomfortable or impossible. Also known as a penis cage. It is used as a [[sex toy]] as a method of erotic sexual denial.

Not to be confused with a [[chastity belt]], which serves a similar purpose, but wraps around the wearer's entire waist instead of just the penis. If the "belt" is a strap, band or chain connected to a chastity cage, use [[chastity cage strap]]. If it's really a chastity belt that is also a penis cage, use [[chastity cage-belt]].

h4. Related tags

h6. Main types

Most chastity cages can be tagged with 1 and only 1 of the tags below.

* [[flat chastity cage]] [tn]Small, flat and deeper than testicles.[/tn]
* [[nub chastity cage]] [tn]Small, round and symmetrical.[/tn]
* [[revealing chastity cage]] [tn]Made of metal rings, wires, straps, or an open frame / mesh that lets you see the penis inside the cage.[/tn]
* [[tube chastity cage]] [tn]Encases and hides the penis inside a tube.[/tn]

h6. Special types

* [[chastity cage-belt]] [tn]A chastity belt-shaped chastity cage.[/tn]
* [[double end chastity cage]] [tn]A cage for two.[/tn]

h6. Size

* [[small chastity cage]] [tn]Shorter than [[testicles]].[/tn]
* [[large chastity cage]] [tn]Longer and thicker, can fit a normal penis [[half-erect]] or fully erect inside.[/tn]

h6. Design

* [[ornate chastity cage]] [tn]A cage with a fancy design like [[bunny ears]].[/tn]
* [[padlocked chastity cage]] [tn]A cage with a [[padlock]] locking it. Could be a [[heart-shaped lock]].[/tn]
* [[chastity cage strap]] [tn]A belt, band or chain strapped to the cage circling around the waist that holds it in place.[/tn]
* [[ball splitter]] [tn]A strap that goes between the [[testicles]] making them bulge out.[/tn]
* [[inverted chastity cage]] [tn]A cage that pushes the penis into the crotch.[/tn]

h6. Colors

* [[metal chastity cage]]
* [[gold chastity cage]]
* [[colored chastity cage]]
* [[transparent chastity cage]] [tn]Glass-like.[/tn]

h6. Actions

* [[chastity cage emission]] [tn]When [[cum]] or [[precum]] is coming out of a chastity cage.[/tn]
* [[bulging in chastity cage]] [tn]When the tip or shaft of the penis is bulging out of holes in the cage.[/tn]
* [[unworn chastity cage]] [tn]A chastity cage on scene that nobody is wearing.[/tn]
* [[holding chastity cage]] [tn]Holding an unworn cage.[/tn]
* [[touching another's chastity cage]] [tn]Touching a cage worn by someone else with any body part. Use [[testicle grab]] or [[caressing testicles]] instead if it's not touching the cage.[/tn]
* [[touching own chastity cage]] [tn]Touching your own cage.[/tn]
* [[partially worn chastity cage]] [tn]A cage being removed or placed.[/tn]
* [[chastity cage visible through clothes]] [tn]A cage visible through clothes.[/tn]
* [[sex toy replacing penis]] [tn]When a [[dildo]] or [[strap-on]] is used instead of the character's [[penis]].[/tn]

h6. Other tags

* [[chastity key]] [tn]The key to a cage or belt. Combine with [[key necklace]] or [[holding key]].[/tn]
* [[chastity belt]]
* [[chastity piercing]]
* [[chastity bra]]
* [[unworn chastity cage]]

title: kamen_rider_dragon_knight
body:
The American adaptation of [[Kamen Rider Ryuki (series)|]], which aired from 2008 to 2009. It is the second of only 2 Americanized Kamen Rider adaptations, the first being Saban's controversial [[Saban's Masked Rider|Masked Rider]] adaptation of Kamen Rider Black RX.

The series was later dubbed and aired in Japanese, and featured a voice cast that included many former Rider actors. Due to the dub's popularity, a Japan-exclusive sequel novel to the series was released in 2010.

title: hoshi_wo_miru_hito
body:
[b]Hoshi wo Miru Hito[/b] (lit. "Stargazer") is an RPG game developed by Another and published by HOT-B in 1987 for [[Famicom]]. Due to it's glaring flaws, it's known as the "densetsu no kusoge" (ä¼èª¬ã®ã‚¯ã‚½ã‚²ãƒ¼ legendary shitty game). A patch was released to balance the game and improve the graphics in its subsequent release, and there even exists two fan remakes.

In May 2020, it was revealed that the game would receive a digital re-release on the Nintendo Switch in the summer later that year, and was released worldwide on July 30th. Despite the worldwide release, the game was not translated, meaning it's only in Japanese.

h4. See also
* [[Stargazer (series)|Stargazer]] (a fan remake released on 2009)
* [[Romancing Stella Visor]] (a fan remake released in 2015)

title: gouf_custom
body:
A fictional manned giant robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It first appeared in the [[Gundam 08th MS Team]] OVA from 1996.

[b]MS-07B-3 Gouf Custom[/b]

An updated version of the venerable [[Gouf]] [[mobile_suit|MS]] with a hybrid Gatling shield, a redone heat wire instead of the heavy heat rod, and improved versatility. An unit was famously piloted by Commander [[Norris Packard]] in Southeast Asia during [[mobile_suit_gundam|The One Year War]] against the fearsome 08th MS Team and their powerful [[ground_gundam|Gundam Ground Types]].

Also featured more recently in [[Gundam Requiem for Vengeance]].

title: hizack_custom
body:
A fictional manned giant robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It appeared in [[Zeta Gundam]].

[b]RMS-106CS Hizack Custom[/b]

It is a fire support variant of the [[titans_(gundam)|Titans]] [[Hizack]] [[mobile suit]]. Standard [[Earth Federation]] Hizack Customs are blue colored, while the Titans opted for the classic [[Zaku II]] green color scheme for their units. 

After The Gryps War some grey colored units were seen deployed by the [[Neo Zeon]] [[full_frontal|Sleeves]] during their [[gundam_unicorn|Attack on Torrington]] base.

title: at-st
body:
A fictional [[walker (robot)|]] mecha from the [[Star Wars]] [[Science Fiction]] series. It first appeared in the [[Star Wars: The Empire Strikes Back]] film from 1980.

The [i]Kuat Drive Yards[/i] [b]All Terrain Scout Transport Walker[/b], also known as the [b]Chicken Walker[/b] or simply as the [b]AT-ST Walker[/b], was a small bipedal [[mecha]] used by the Galactic Republic during the late Clone Wars and, later and more extensively, the [[Galactic Empire (star Wars)|]] during the Galactic Civil War. 

The standard model was equipped with a chin-mounted double medium blaster cannon, a concussion grenade launcher on the starboard side of its head, two feet with claws, a blaster cannon on the port side and laser resistant armor. 

The AT-ST was designed to be a reconnaissance attack vehicle. It was lighter than its bigger brother, the [[AT-AT]], and could withstand standard blaster fire, but was vulnerable to heavy laser fire and missiles, as well as physical attacks to the legs and the sides of the cockpit. 

While initially designed for multiple terrains, it was later used in urban areas mostly, where it proved to be more effective as an infantry support unit.

The AT-ST was designed in the early 80s.

h4. See also
* [[Regult]] -  A mecha anime walker inspired by this unit.

title: regult
body:
[[Zentradi]] [[alien]] one-man tactical aerospace [[walker (robot)|]] [[mecha]] that first appeared in the [b][I][[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]][/i][/b] 1982 anime series.

The [[Esbeliben]] [b]Regult[/b] is a lightly armored combat walker, but compensates this by having its [[maclone]] pilot equipped with a heavy [[armor]]ed [[spacesuit]] and by being armed with several energy cannons and other powerful weaponry. 

The standard version is armed with 2 pivoting forward firing medium-bore electron beam guns, 2 forward and downward firing pivoting small-bore anti-personnel cannons and a self-defense rear aimed upper turret with 2 small-bore anti-aircraft laser guns.

While primarily designed as an all-terrain, ground based, motorized infantry and armored support unit, this mecha also has superior speed and maneuverability in [[space]] thanks to its high number of [[vernier thrusters]]. Very easy to produce, repair, modify and pilot, the Regult is usually deployed in very vast numbers and in massive attack waves to overwhelm, encircle and obliterate the enemy. It is the main attack mecha of all the Zentradi forces and is produced in the trillions in massive automated factories scattered across the [[milky way]] [[galaxy]].

There are specialized variants of the walker, which range from light and heavy [[artillery]] versions armed with [[missile]]s to an unarmed version designed for Reconaissance and Electronic Countermeasure missions.

In [[real life]] the Regult was designed by [[Kawamori Shouji]] in the early 80s and its design was inspired by the [[T-34]] [[tank]]s of [[World War II]] and the [[AT-ST]] from [[Star Wars]]. It was renamed as the [b]Tactical Battle Pod[/b] in the [[Robotech]] adaptation.

h4. See also

* [[Glaug]]

title: metropolis_(fritz_lang)
body:
[b]Metropolis[/b] is a 1927 German expressionist epic [[science fiction]] silent drama film directed by "Fritz Lang":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fritz_Lang . He and his wife, Thea von Harbou, wrote the silent film, which starred Gustav FrÃ¶hlich, Brigitte Helm, Alfred Abel and Rudolf Klein-Rogge. Erich Pommer produced it in the Babelsberg Studios for Universum Film A.G. 

It is regarded as a pioneering work of the serious science fiction genre in movies, being among the first feature length movies of the genre ever made. It also has been considered a semi-[[cyberpunk]] film created many decades before the genre even began. 

Metropolis is set in a futuristic urban dystopia and follows the attempts of Freder, the wealthy son of the city's ruler, and Maria, a poor worker, to overcome the vast gulf separating the classes of their city. 

The movie was made in [[Germany]] during the "Weimar Period":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Weimar_Republic]. Filming took place in 1925 at a cost of approximately five million Reichsmarks. The art direction draws influence from Bauhaus, Cubist and Futurist design.

Metropolis was met with a mixed reception upon release. Critics found it pictorially beautiful and lauded its complex special effects, but accused its story of naivetÃ©.

Numerous attempts have been made to restore the film since the 1970s. Music producer Giorgio Moroder released a truncated version with a soundtrack by rock artists such as [[Freddie Mercury]], Loverboy and Adam Ant in 1984. A new reconstruction of Metropolis was shown at the Berlin Film Festival in 2001, and the film was inscribed on UNESCO's Memory of the World Register in the same year, the first film thus distinguished. 

In 2008 a damaged print of Lang's original cut of the film was found in a museum in Argentina. After a long restoration process, the film was 95% restored and shown on large screens in Berlin and Frankfurt simultaneously on 12 February 2010.

h4. See also

* [[Maschinenmensch]]
* [[Metropolis]] ([[Tezuka Osamu]] manga and anime inspired by this film)

title: doraemon_(character)
body:
The titular character of [[Doraemon]]. A prototype blue "cat [[robot]]" from the 22nd century that helps [[Nobi Nobita]] escape his doomed life in the future by turning him from a lazy boy into a responsible man.

He is a fat, short-sized robot. With height, weight, and other stats at 129.3 cm/kg, tied with his birthday in Year/Month/Day format (2112/9/3).

He has a round-shaped head. His body is blue, with white on his face and stomach. He has a [[red nose]] and a "[[tail]]" which is red ball placed on a thin wire. He wears a [[red collar]] with a yellow [[jingle bell]]. Because of his overall appearance he is often mistaken for a [[tanuki]] or a [[raccoon]], which can makes him angry. 

He has a "Fouth Dimension Bag" on his stomach in which he carries various gadgets from the future. Some gadgets are helpful, while some others are destructive (including an [[armageddon bomb|atomic bomb]]) despite the fact that he was originally build as a "Friend and Baby-Walker Robot".

He's brought home by Nobita's great-great-grandson, named [[Nobi Sewashi]], as an "incomplete prototype robot" from a robot factory. Because of this, most of his basic features such infrared eyes and nimble cat feet do not function. 

He is overly afraid on rats, mice, and anything similar because his ears were bitten by rats. In contrast with rats and mice, he's very fond of [[dorayaki]]. He will occasionally get mad if he does not eat dorayaki for 2 or 3 days. He will do anything for dorayaki. Because of this, Nobita often bribes Doraemon with dorayaki in exchange for borrowing some gadget. 

Because of his popularity in and out of [[Japan]] he was officially named by the Japanese government as a [b]Cultural ambassador of modern Japan[/b]. He is also portrayed by Jean Reno and Bruce Willis in several Toyota and SoftBank commercials respectively, so you know he means business.

He is primarily voiced by [[Ooyama Nobuyo]] from 1979 to 2005.

h4. See also
* [[Dorami]] - Doraemon's sister figure
* [[Monodora]]

title: wasabi
body:
A spice that has an extremely strong flavor. Its hotness is more akin to that of a hot mustard rather than the capsaicin in a chili pepper, producing vapors that stimulate the nasal passages more than the tongue.

Due to restraints on mass cultivation, especially outside of Japan, cheap "wasabi" is typically made from the faster and easier growing horseradish which they dye green.  Horseradish is a relative of wasabi and is commonly referred to as "western wasabi" (è¥¿æ´‹ã‚ã•ã³) in Japan.

title: cortana
body:
The AI companion to the [[Master Chief]] in the [[halo (series)|numbered Halo games]]. 

Cortana is an experimental model physically and mentally based off of her creator, Dr. Catherine Halsey, who also created the [[SPARTAN (halo)|]] supersoldiers.

Cortana is a highly-intelligent individual with a dry sense of humor, and alongside Master Chief, the Arbiter, and Sgt. Avery Johnson, serves as one of the "faces" of the [i]Halo[/i] franchise.

Due to her popularity, [[Microsoft]] named an assistant AI featured in [[Windows 8]] onwards after Cortana.

title: master_chief
body:
The main player character in the numbered [[halo (series)|Halo]] games.

Officially known as [b]Master Chief Petty Officer John-117[/b], or simply "Master Chief", he is a supersoldier created by the United Nations Space Command known as a [[SPARTAN (halo)|]], tasked with performing operations that would be exceedingly difficult for unaugmented humans.

His most famous exploits came during the Human-Covenant War, in which he destroyed one of the titular Halo rings, assassinated one of the Covenant's leaders, and played a key role in stopping the parasite known as the Flood for good, among other heroic acts.

John is one of the most iconic video game characters in the Western world, with his distinctive appearance and gravelly voice, provided by Steven Downes.

title: kankaku_shadan
body:
[b]Kankaku shaden[/b] (lit. "[[Sensory deprivation]]" or "Sense blocking pit") is a fetish consisting of a character falling into a [[tentacle pit]] and being [[tentacle sex|ravaged by tentacles]], while being [[unaware]] of what's happening to them due to having their senses cut off, usually by either magic or paralyzing poison.

Often includes a follow up where the sensory nulling ends for one reason or another, which causes the victim to be forced to feel intense senses of overwhelming pleasure all at once. [[Breast expansion]] and [[inflation]] are often present as well.

The fetish originates from post #6364507 by [[Shirabe Shiki]], which also gives the fetish its name.

In rare cases when a [[tentacle pit]] is not involved but the setting is otherwise similar, the tag is still applicable.

Note that this tag is for the specific combination of sensory deprivation and tentacle pits only. For other sensory deprivation works, use [[emotionless sex]] instead.

h4. See also

* [[tentacle sex]]
* [[emotionless sex]]

title: spartan_(halo)
body:
The typical player characters in the [[halo (series)|Halo]] franchise. 

They are [[space marine]] super[[soldier]]s created by the United Nations Space Command, candidates are given extensive genetic and physical augmentations, and, starting from the second generation, their iconic MJOLNIR powered armor.

In-universe, the project initially started to create an elite force to quell a growing insurrection against the UNSC. Initial candidates were adult volunteers, but the first phase of the project was considered a failure. Eventually, under the lead of Dr. Catherine Halsey, the second generation would be approved, infamously seeing to the abduction of several dozen children from across human space settlements. These children would be indoctrinated and given much more extensive and invasive augmentations and would be deployed just in time for the Human-Covenant War. 

The SPARTAN-IIs would be the most famous and successful generation, eventually being supplemented by the cheaper SPARTAN III program, making use of war orphans and using them as "fire-and-forget" weapons in one-off high-risk operations that resulted in high casualties. After the war's conclusion, the program would come full circle and the SPARTAN-IVs would consist of adult volunteers undergoing a more refined augmentation process.

h4. See also

* [[Master Chief]]
* [[Spartan-B312]]

Her skin is [[patchwork skin|patchwork]] with [[white skin|white]] and [[grey skin|grey]] segments. She may [[holding bouquet|hold a bouquet]].

title: trigger-chan
body:
Leader of the TRIGGER Girls trio, and the primary [[mascot]] of [[trigger (company)|Studio TRIGGER]]. She was designed by [[Imaishi Hiroyuki]], with later illustrations having her drawn by [[Mago]].

She wears a [[striped bikini]] top, a white [[cropped jacket]] with [[short shorts]], and [[black gloves|black]] [[skeleton print]] [[elbow gloves]]. She has [[short hair|short]] [[red hair]] with a trigger-shaped [[ahoge]], and wears green [[safety glasses]] on her head. She also has [[aqua eyes]]. She carries a set of [[chibi]] [[grenade]]s named [[Frag (trigger)|]].

Her secret identity is that of 13-year old [[Luluco]]. She is stated to be Luluco's 17-year old self, and can transform into her at will.

h4. See also

* [[List of Official Mascots]]

title: houraisan_kaguya
body:
The "Eternal Lunar Princess". Final boss of [[Touhou]]'s [[Imperishable Night]], imbued with the power of immortality.

The former princess of the Lunarians, banished to Earth for drinking the Hourai Elixir, which gave her immortality. She has since settled in Eientei, a mansion deep within a bamboo forest in [[Gensokyo]], where she came to love the humans she once detested and her new, easygoing life. Because of this, she is comically depicted in fanon as a [[NEET]] who is always dependent on her bodyguard and creator of the Hourai Elixir, [[Yagokoro Eirin]]. She is also the master of lunar rabbit [[Reisen Udongein Inaba]].

She shares a bitter rivalry with [[Fujiwara no Mokou]], daughter of one of her many spurned suitors. Both have since been killing each other for centuries, despite knowing that neither can permanently die.

h4. See also

* [[Kaguya Day]] (8th September)
* [[Kaguya Hime]] - the character from the folktale.
* [[Tasukete Eirin]] - a joke on her dependence on Eirin

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Kaguya Houraisan":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Kaguya_Houraisan
* "Wikipedia: The Tale of the Bamboo Cutter":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Tale_of_the_Bamboo_Cutter - the ancient Japanese folktale upon which Kaguya's character is based.

title: milking_machine
body:
A device designed to extract milk from animals or people. The devices use cylinders or cups placed over the teat and then uses suction to induce [[lactation]]. 

Devices designed to extract milk for a lactating woman are called "[[breast pump]]s," and may be manual or automatic.  Devices designed to extract milk from animals, particularly diary cows, are called "milking machines," and are automatic.

h4. Body Suction Devices
* [[breast enlargement pump]]
* [[breast pump]]
* [[clitoris pump]]
* [[penis pump]]

title: breast_pump
body:
A device designed to assist in lactation among [i]human[/i] mothers for the purpose of filling bottles with milk for their children using suction.  

[[Milking machine]] is a more generic term for devices to induce lactation among any animal.  All breast pumps are milking machines, but if it is not for humans, (such as the especially popular cow milking machine) it's not a breast pump, but is a milking machine.  

Post #1715415 is an example of a breast pump. Post #97533 is a generic milking machine.

h4. Body Suction Devices
* [[breast enlargement pump]] (a similar device designed for a different purpose)
* [[clitoris pump]]
* [[milking machine]]
* [[penis pump]]

title: breast_enlargement_pump
body:
A device similar to the [[breast pump]]s designed for milking, they're a device sold on the rumor that one can enlarge breast size through stretching breast tissue.  They operate using large cups designed to engulf the breast so a pump can create a vacuum in the cups that pulls upon the breast and "stretches" the tissue to supposedly aid in their growth.  They're typically used by people with [[breast envy]].

title: houshou_marine_(nun)
body:
An [[alternate costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Houshou Marine]]. Originated from a fanart by [[Oshiruko (oshiruco 212048)|]] posted on the end of October 2022, which was later used by Marine herself for the use in her "sin confessions" stream. A [[revealing clothes|skimpy]] version of the costume also briefly appeared in her first confession stream.

The costume consists of a dark blue [[nun]] habit with white double triangular [[breast curtain]]s and a dark blue [[pelvic curtain]]. There are two "skimpy" versions of the outfit, one with the inner garments removed (including [[no bra|bra]] and [[no panties|panties]]) revealing the wearer's [[underboob]] and only has the aforementioned curtains to cover their private parts. The other "skimpy" version swaps the long pelvic curtain for an even shorter one covering the crotch, leaving the [[midriff]] exposed. On December 2022, a revised version of the original costume was revealed. This version of the costume differs by using the same hairstyle of her [[houshou marine (marching band)|band costume]] and the addition of a suggestive [[underboob cutout]] on the costume.
 
While this costume is technically unofficial (as it never received an official model for obvious reasons), it has gained notoriety within and out of the Hololive fanbase for its frequent usage by Marine herself, which resulted in it gaining the status of a [[meme attire]].

This tag is applicable to any posts that:
* Features Marine herself wearing any variant of the outfit or derivative of it, and not a generic [[nun]] outfit.
* Has other character(s) wearing any variant of the outfit or derivative of it. In this case, the tag [[Houshou Marine (cosplay)]] is applicable.

h4. Appearance

* !post #4880115: 1st version (normal)
* !post #4880121: 1st version (skimpy variant 1)
* !post #4882536: 1st version (skimpy variant 2)
* !post #5924061: 2nd version

h4. See also

* [[Houshou Marine (Ahoy!! You're All Pirates)|Ahoy!! You're All Pirates]] - an official costume using nun elements

title: topless
body:
Nude from the waist up. Not wearing a top, but wearing bottoms. For example, wearing [[pants]] or a [[skirt]] without a [[shirt]] or [[bra]].

h6. Guidelines

* Don't use when the character is [[nude]] or [[completely nude]].
* Don't use when you can't see the character's lower body. You should be able to tell the character is wearing bottom clothing. Use [[nude]] instead.
* Don't use if the character is wearing a [[bra]] or [[bikini top only|bikini top]]. Use [[no shirt]] instead.
* Don't use [[bare shoulders]], [[bare back]], or [[bare arms]] with this tag.
* Don't use this tag for male characters. [[Topless]] is for female characters only. See [[topless male]] for male characters.
* Don't use for [[monster girl]]s who don't normally wear bottom clothing. Use [[nude]] instead.
* Don't use this tag if the character is wearing only a [[corset]].
* Wearing [[pasties]] or [[bondage]] still counts as topless.

h4. See also

* [[bottomless]]
* [[no bra]]
* [[no shirt]]
* [[topless male]] - male equivalent
* [[Tag Group:Sexual Attire]]

title: bottomless
body:
Nude from the waist down. Wearing a top, but no bottoms. 

For example, wearing a [[shirt]] or other top without any [[pants]], [[underwear]], or other bottom clothing.

When considering if a character qualifies the post for this tag, follow the rules below.

h5. Rules for usage

* [b]Do not use[/b] when the character is fully [[nude]].
* [b]Do not use[/b] when you can't see the character's upper body. You should be able to tell the character is wearing a top.
* [b]Do not use[/b] when the character is wearing [[panties]] or [[underwear]]. Use [[no pants]] instead.
* [b]Do not use[/b] when the character is wearing a [[skirt]] or [[dress]] without underwear. Use [[no panties]] or [[no male underwear]] instead.
* [b]Do not use[/b] when the character is pulling their [[panties]] or [[underwear]] down or aside.
* [b]Do not use[/b] when the character is only wearing a [[pantyhose]]. In this case, use both [[no pants]] and [[no panties]] instead.
* [b]Do not use[/b] for [[monster girl]]s or [[monster boy]]s who don't normally wear clothing from the waist up. Use [[nude]] instead.
* [b]Do not use[/b] [[bare legs]] with this tag.
* Wearing [[garter belt]], [[garter straps]], [[maebari]], [[thighhighs]], [[socks]], or [[shoes]] still counts as [[bottomless]].
* If you can't tell that the character isn't wearing [[underwear]], use [[no pants]] instead.

h4. Examples

* !post #18256: Basic bottomless
* !post #52206: Bottomless one-piece swimsuit
* !post #114711: No bikini bottom
* !post #8814138: Bottomless with thighhighs

h4. See also

* [[No panties]]
* [[No pants]]
* [[No male underwear]]
* [[Topless]]
* [[Topless male]]
* [[Tag group:Sexual attire]]

title: traditional_nun
body:
A traditional [[nun]]'s habit, specifically a traditional Christian style (Catholic, Orthodox, etc), as opposed to the fetishized, non-traditional nun habits typically seen in anime and fanart.

It consists at most of a [[long dress|long dress]] (that's black) with [[long sleeves]] and a [[guimpe]] (that's white), and typically stars the distinctive nun headdress (consisting of a [[wimple]]/[[coif]] [that's white], headwear bandeau [that's white], and [[veil]] [that's black], though it has become increasingly optional for some since the 20th century), and may also include a [[tabard]], underdress, and so on. The habit is typically white-on-black, with black the predominant color, but they can also be wholly white, or white-on-blue. Color can depend on the religious order which the nun is a part of (ex. Carmelites being white-on-brown). They can also be wholly black, which is the common choice for Orthodox nuns.

The traditional habit can be accentuated with minor additions, but not so much that it detracts from the basics (ex. [[Sister Claire]] and [[Double (skullgirls)|]] as opposed to [[Specter (arknights)|]] and [[Index (toaru majutsu no index)|]]), and some degree of modesty must be adhered to (ex. not too tight-fitting, no shortened dresses, no cutouts, no openings where they wouldn't normally be ala the chest area, no side slits which reveal skin or undergarment, no overtly sexual depictions of certain undergarments, etc).

h4. Examples

* !post #6716988: Wholly traditional
* !post #3752558: Without headdress
* !post #3432046: Minor flourishes

h4. See also

* [[nun]]

h4. External links

* "S.D. Cason Catholic Gallery: Top 12 Orders of Catholic Nuns and Sisters":https://sdcason.com/orders-of-catholic-nuns-and-sisters/

Her regular hairstyle consist of a pair of [[half up half down braid]] tied with a [[hair ribbon|ribbon]] into a [[low ponytail]] (although since she's seen from the front most of the time, artist usually depict it as just a [[half up braid]]), she also wears a [[hair flower]] and [[snowflake hair ornament]].

title: yor_briar
body:
One of the three main characters of [[Spy x Family]]. She is an assassin under the code name "Thorn Princess". She use her signature ring-pommeled [[stiletto (weapon)|]]s as her weapon.

As a part of her cover identity, she is pretending to be the wife of [[Twilight (spy x family)|]]. Both characters are unaware of the other party's secret identity. She is also acting as stepmother for [[Anya (spy x family)|]] and adores her new stepdaughter. While she's off-duty, she works as a clerk at the city hall.

She is by voiced by [[Hayami Saori]] in Japanese and Natalie Van Sistine in English.

h4. Other names

* [b]Yor Forger:[/b] NÃ©e "Briar", assumed 'legal' name after 'marrying'  [[twilight (spy x family)|'Loid Forger']].
* [b]Yoru Folger:[/b] Transliteration used in earlier official English translations.

title: twilight_(spy_x_family)
body:
One of the three main characters of [[Spy x Family]]. He is a spy with his real name unrevealed; he uses "Twilight" as his code name. Also known by his cover civilian name [b]Loid Forger[/b].

He is operating in the setting's analog of East Germany, under the cover identity of "Loid Forger". As part of this cover identity, he is 'married' to [[Yor Briar]] and 'father' to [[Anya (spy x family)|]].

He is voiced by [[Eguchi Takuya]] in Japanese and Alex Organ in English.

h4. Other names

* [b]Lloyd Folger:[/b] Transliteration used in earlier official English translations.

title: anya_(spy_x_family)
body:
One of the three main characters of [[Spy x Family]].

She is a young girl who is a former experimental subject, granting [[mind reading]] abilities. 'Adopted' by [[Twilight (spy x family)|]] as part of the latter's cover identity. As such, she is also the adoptive 'stepdaughter' of  [[Yor Briar]]. Can be seen with plushes, such as [[Director Chimera (spy x family)|]] and Agent Penguinman.

Has [[pink hair]] with [[hairpods]] covering [[cone hair bun]]s.

She is voiced by [[Tanezaki Atsumi]] in Japanese and Megan Shipman in English.

h4. Other names

* [b]Anya Forger:[/b] Assumed 'legal name' after being adopted by 'Loid Forger'.
* [b]Subject 007:[/b] Her 'name' during her experimental subject days.
* [b]Anya Folger:[/b] Transliteration used in some of the earlier official English translations.
* [b]Ania:[/b] Name as spelled in the original Japanese series, on occasions when Latin letter script is used. Short Mission 11 has Loid correcting her and changing it to 'Anya', to her surprise. Also name used in some of the earlier official English translations. Polish variant of "Anna"/"Anya".

h4. See also

* [[Anya's heh face (meme)]]
* [[wakuwaku (spy x family)|]]

title: superstar!!_(love_live!)
body: An insert song from [[Love Live! Superstar!!]], performed by 11-member Liella!. It is their entry for the Love Live! Finals.

title: sleeping_bag
body:
An insulated covering for a person that can be closed with a zipper or similar means to form a tube, which functions as a portable bedding in situations where a person is sleeping outdoors, like [[camping]].

h4. See also

* [[Bag]]
* [[Shark sleeping bag]]
* [[Wearable sleeping bag]]

title: wearable_sleeping_bag
body:
A type of [[sleeping bag]] that, as the name suggests, can be worn like a clothing item and allows the wearer to walk around due to the leg protrusion.

Originally, it was a [[meme attire]] in the Japanese community due to a magazine ad featuring a man wearing the sleeping bag while walking in a peculiar pose. In later times, however, it is often mistaken as a reference to the [[Crewmate (among us)|]] from [[Among Us]] due to their strikingly similar appearance, especially with the wearer appearing as if they have [[no arms]].

h5. Examples
* !asset #24802457: The original ad
* !post #689772: [[Touhou]]'s [[Houraisan Kaguya]] wearing the sleeping bag. This image and a derivative of it is often associated with the phase "haters gonna hate".

title: ameth_(princess_connect!)
body:
A character from [[Princess Connect!]] and Princess Connect! Re:Dive. [spoiler]She is a former Fairy that accompanied Yuuki and Twinkle Wish on their adventures before the events of Re:Dive.[/spoiler]

She has [[blue eyes]], [[pointy ears]], [[small breasts]], and [[very long hair|very long]] [[two-tone hair|two-tone]] [[gradient hair|gradient]] [[purple hair|purple]] & [[green hair]] stylized in [[twintails]] with [[blunt bangs]] & [[drill sidelocks]]. As well as a [[halo]]. She wears a [[pink flower|pink]] [[hair flower]], [[black shirt|black]] [[sleeveless shirt]], [[red skirt]], [[black gloves]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[thigh boots]].

She is voiced by [[Takahashi Rie]] in the first season of the anime, and [[Aisaka Yuuka]] in the second season as well as in the game.

title: kamen_rider_delta
body:
Kamen Rider Delta is the third (and last in the TV series) Rider to appear in [[kamen_rider_555|Kamen Rider 555]]. Delta has a black color scheme with white Photon Blood (blue when transforming) flowing through its body. Delta is patterned after a mantis and the Greek letter delta (Î”).

Delta is remarkable for being the first Rider Gear to be used by a female in a TV series ([[Kimura Saya]] being its off-screen main user, and later Abe Rina using it on screen for a brief moment), alongside [[Kamen Rider Kaixa]]. 

The Gear itself constantly switches hands, going from Saya to Kitazaki, the [[Dragon Orphnoch]], and then to Mihara Shuji, who proceeds to use it for most of the time, though other one-time users of Delta include the aforementioned Rina, [[Inui Takumi]], [[Kusaka Masato]] and Murakami Kyouji, the Rose Orphnoch.

title: kimi_no_koto_ga_dai_dai_dai_dai_daisuki_na_100-nin_no_kanojo
body:
[i]Kimi no koto ga Dai Dai Dai Dai Daisuki na 100-nin no Kanojo[/i] ([i]The 100 Girlfriends Who Really, Really, Really, Really, Really Love You[/i]) is a harem romantic comedy manga written by Rikito Nakamura and illustrated by [[Nozawa Yukiko]]. It began serialization on December 26, 2019.

It follows high school student [[Aijou Rentarou]], who in his lifetime fell in love and confessed to exactly 100 girls, only to be rejected by all of them. While praying in a shrine, Rentarou is approached by the God of Love, who reveals that he, due to an error, is destined to have 100 soulmates. However, he also tells Rentarou that if he does not return the feelings of any of his soulmates, they will suffer an accident and die. Not wanting this to happen, Rentarou is determined not to let any of his soulmates die as he meets and dates them all at the same time.

title: among_us
body:
A social intrigue party game developed and published in 2018 by InnerSloth, in which players are randomly divided into [[Crewmate (among us)|]]s and  [[Impostor (among us)|]]s. The Crewmates must attempt to complete all required tasks and/or expose the Impostors, while the secret Impostors must [[murder]] or frame the Crewmates or sabotage the Crewmates' efforts.

Although released in 2018 as a relatively little-known game, it had a sudden boom in popularity in September 2020, with regular concurrent numbers of well over 250,000, reaching widespread [[meme|memetic]] status on the Internet. The game has a low entry barrier and cross-platform play, allowing users across all devices to enjoy the up-to-15-multiplayer experience. Also notable for its dark yet cute style and slapstick cartoon violence.

The game would later spawn a wide variety of post-ironic [[meme|memes]] in 2021, usually revolving around a parody of [[Stonetoss (style)|]] comics, a [[when the imposter is sus (meme)|photoshopped image]] of [[Jerma985]], anything that looks like the in-game characters and/or having the name sounded like "Among Us/Amogus" or "Sus", or simply using the in-game character itself as a "punchline".

title: blackmail
body:
A crime of [[threat]]ening and harassing a person with public exposure, influencing their actions by using unfair pressure.
Usually, the perpetrator has some kind of leverage to make the victim comply (secrets, an item or person held hostage, etc).

h4.See also

title: kamen_rider_dark_kabuto
body: Kamen Rider Dark Kabuto - [spoiler]Souji Kusakabe[/spoiler] - is the last Rider to appear in [[kamen_rider_kabuto_(series)|Kamen Rider Kabuto]]. As the name suggests, Dark Kabuto is a fully black-colored version of the regular [[kamen_rider_kabuto|Kabuto]], but also with a yellow visor and glowing circuitry on the breastplate.

title: kamen_rider_sasword
body: Kamen Rider Sasword - Tsurugi Kamishiro - is the fourth Rider to appear in [[kamen_rider_kabuto_(series)|Kamen Rider Kabuto]]. Sasword has a black-and-violet color scheme and is patterned after a scorpion.

title: kamen_rider_thebee
body: Kamen Rider TheBee is the second Rider to appear in [[kamen_rider_kabuto_(series)|Kamen Rider Kabuto]]. TheBee has a black-and-yellow color scheme, and is patterned after both a bee and a wasp.

title: kamen_rider_drake
body: Kamen Rider Drake - Daisuke Kazama - is the third Rider to appear in [[kamen_rider_kabuto_(series)|Kamen Rider Kabuto]]. Drake has a black-and-cyan color scheme, and is patterned after a dragonfly.

title: alisa_ilinichina_amiella
body:
Major character and poster girl from the [[God Eater]] series. A member of the Russian branch God Eater squad who joined the organization to exact revenge on the [[Aragami]] who killed her parents. She is voiced by [[Sakamoto Maaya]].

Alisa's most notable characteristic is her [[revealing clothes|revealing]] shirt that exposes her [[cleavage]] and [[underboob]] with [[no bra]] under it. This peculiar choice of clothes is explained in a running gag as being caused by her "tailor-made" shirt being way too undersized compared to her [[large breasts]].

title: do_deuce_(racehorse)
body:
[tn]As in "Do a deuce", to tie a game in [[tennis]].[/tn]

Japanese [[horse|racehorse]]. Sired by Heart's Cry and foaled by Dust and Diamonds.

A bay horse with a star and stripe marking and no leg markings. His first G1 win was at the 2021 Asahi Hai Futurity Stakes. He would later become famous as the winner of the 2022 Japanese Derby ([[Tokyo Yushun]]), defeating [[Equinox (racehorse)|]], who would finally flourish at the 2022 Autumn Tenno-sho and dominate the field onwards. After a failed bet at l'Arc, a win at the Kyoto Kinen and having his main jockey (the legendary [[Take Yutaka]]) incapacitated during his rematches with Equinox, Do Deuce would finally claim his third G1 win at the 2023 [[Arima Kinen]], after Equinox's retirement and with Take Yutaka. He would later claim his fourth G1 at the 2024 Autumn Tenno Sho, making him the first colt in history to have JRA G1 victories every year from age 2 to age 5. Among the fillies, only [[Mejiro Dober (racehorse)|]], [[Vodka (racehorse)|]] and [[Buena Vista (racehorse)|]] did the same. Not long after, he claimed his fifth G1 at the 2024 Japan Cup, edging out Shin Emperor and Durezza (who finished in dead heat) by a neck. Unfortunately, he was scratched from the 2024 Arima Kinen due to lameness on one of his legs at a poor time.

He is also infamous for being a large eater, something often shown when he is personified as a [i][[Umamusume]][/i] [[horse girl]]. This is more salient due to his jockey comparing him to [[Special Week (racehorse)|]] on how they look like ([[Special Week (umamusume)|]] is also a large eater in Umamusume), even leading people to call him the Supreme Commander of the Reiwa era due to his performances.

body:
One of the main characters of [[Guild no Uketsukejou desu ga Zangyou wa Iya nanode Boss wo Solo Toubatsu Shiyou to Omoimasu|Guild no Uketsukejou desu ga, Zangyou wa Iya nanode Boss wo Solo Toubatsu Shiyou to Omoimasu]].

body: A type of [[clitoris piercing]], clitoris bars are [[barbell piercing]]s affixed to the [[clitoris]]. The most common form is a simple straight bar with beads on each end.

title: contrail_(racehorse)
body:
Japanese racehorse. Sired by [[Deep Impact (racehorse)|]] and foaled by Rhodochrosite. He became famous as the 8th recipient of the Japanese Triple Crown in 2020. Him and Deep Impact are the only pair of father and son to have both won a Triple Crown (and coincidentally, both were also undefeated).

His trademark is his telephone receiver-shaped star marking, even resembling most emoji renditions (ğŸ“) as it is skewed with the top pointing to the upper-left.

h5. Related
* [[Daring Tact (racehorse)|]] - Contemporary and Triple Tiara winner
* [[Panthalassa (racehorse)|]] - Contemporary and stablemate

title: alina_clover
body:
The titular guild receptionist of [[Guild no Uketsukejou desu ga Zangyou wa Iya nanode Boss wo Solo Toubatsu Shiyou to Omoimasu|Guild no Uketsukejou desu ga, Zangyou wa Iya nanode Boss wo Solo Toubatsu Shiyou to Omoimasu]].

She wields a [[huge weapon|huge]] [[hammer]] to solo bosses.

Voiced by [[Takahashi Rie]].

title: almond_eye_(racehorse)
body:
Japanese [[horse|racehorse]]. Sired by [[Lord Kanaloa (racehorse)|]] and foaled by Fusaichi Pandora.

Almond Eye is Japan's most successful racehorse, having won 9 G1 races, breaking the 7 G1 win record held by several other racehorses, including [[Kitasan Black (racehorse)|]], who retired the year before she became famous and [[Vodka (racehorse)|]] with the fillies; a Triple Tiara; the world record on 2400 m (2:20.6, during the 2018 [[Japan Cup]]). She was also the leader of Japan's greatest earning racehorses, surpassing [[T.M. Opera O (racehorse)|]]'s record, until fellow-Silk Racing owned/[[Christophe Lemaire|Lemaire]] ridden [[Equinox (racehorse)|]] surpassed her at his last race at the 2023 Japan Cup.

Almond Eye is a bay mare with a star-and-snip marking and no leg markings. She usually ran with a black hood with a white shadow roll.

title: pudding
body:
In the United States, pudding characteristically denotes a sweet [[milk]]-based [[dessert]] similar in consistency to egg-based custards, though it may also refer to other types such as bread and rice pudding.

In Japan, the "crÃ¨me caramel":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cr%C3%A8me_caramel variety is the most common. Packaged varieties are sold throughout Japanese convenience stores under the name purin (ãƒ—ãƒªãƒ³), or custard pudding. The Spanish word for this dessert, [i]flan[/i], often leads artists to make visual puns involving [[Flandre Scarlet]].

h4. See also

* [[custard]]
* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

body:
[i]A fresh college graduate from Columbiaâ€”he's finally found a company that'll give him a job offer.[/i]

A playable Supporter Operator in [[Arknights]].

A Columbian graduated student with two degrees in engineering and Originium engineering, grew up in an impoverished family, his parent saved him a tuition to send him to a good school.

Currently a member of Rhodes Island Engineering Department and produces mechanical devices to aid the Operators as an Artificer Supporter Operator.

His [[voice actor]] is Yashiro Taku. His artist is [[nineo]].

h4. Appearance
* !post #8832530: Default

title: ramen
body:
A type of Japanese wheat-flour [[noodles|noodle]] popular in East Asian cuisine, derived from Chinese 'lamian' noodles.

The noodle soup dish of the same name is made by serving ramen noodles in beef or fish broth that is flavored with soy sauce or miso, and topped with a variety of items such as [[char-siu]], [[seaweed]], [[heimuer]], [[narutomaki]], [[softboiled egg]], [[chopped spring onion]] and [[kamaboko]]. There are different flavor distinctions for ramen, such as shio (salty), tonkotsu (pork bone), shoyuu (soy), hiyashi (chilled) and miso.

h4.See also

* [[jirou_(ramen)]]
* [[dipping_noodles]]
* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

title: suction_cups
body:
An object that uses the negative fluid pressure of air or water to adhere to nonporous surfaces, creating a partial vacuum. Suction cups are peripheral traits of some animals such as octopuses and squids, and have been reproduced artificially for numerous purposes. 

This tag refers to the suction cups actually found on cephalopods. For artificial cups or devices that function on the same principle, see the following: 

* [[breast pump]]
* [[milking machine]]
* [[nipple clamps]]
* [[suction cup dildo]]

title: koishi_komeiji's_heart-throbbing_adventure
body:
[[Sentaku-bune]]'s [[Niconico]] series, Koishi Komeiji's Heart-Throbbing Adventure (KKHTA). 

[[Komeiji Koishi]], an extra stage boss of [[Subterranean Animism]], goes to upper [[Gensokyo]] to catch a fish for dinner, but she forgets to bring a fishing rod. Seeing the [[Scarlet Devil Mansion]] nearby, she decides to borrow one from them, and from there on Komeiji Koishi's Heart-Throbbing Adventure really begins...

Not all creepy Koishi pictures count. Look for things such as sharp claws, stitching on her 3rd eye, or the phrase, "My hat is my friend, it helps me relax."

title: pizza
body:
A round, baked flat bread that is typically covered in tomato sauce, [[cheese]], and other toppings such as [[pepperoni]] and [[chili pepper]] according to preference or culture. Usually sliced into eight triangular [[pizza slice]]s.

Modern pizza originated from the Neapolitan pizza from Naples, [[Italy]]. It is one of the most popular [[fast food]] in the world.

There are also dessert pizzas that use [[chocolate]], [[cream]], [[candy]] and other sweet ingredients to create a treat resembling pizza.

title: shigure_kai_san_(kancolle)
body:
The third remodel of [i][[Kantai Collection]][/i]'s [[Shigure (kancolle)|]]. 

While originally hinted in the Kantai Collection 2023 Calendar and episode 7 of the [[Kantai_Collection (anime)|second Kancolle anime]], her in-game implementation took place after the anime ended. In her kai san, her uniform turns [[sleeveless]] and gains [[multicolored clothes|white vertical sides]] in a design reminiscent of [[Kawakaze Kai Ni (Kancolle)|Kawakaze]] and [[Umikaze Kai Ni (Kancolle)|Umikaze's]]. Her [[serafuku]] turns into a [[black jacket]] that she wears [[off shoulder]], and also wears a [[white belt]] and black [[chest harness]]es. 

Her [[rigging]] at Kai San form still consists of her back-mounted 12.7 cm twin gun mount plus two 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]] on [[thigh strap]]s, but the PLAMATEA figure reveals that her back gun mount can be split into two halves bearing one gun each and held by joints.

title: wario
body:
[b]Wa[/b]rui ("ã‚ã‚‹ã„":[https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/%E3%82%8F%E3%82%8B%E3%81%84#Japanese], Japanese for bad, evil, etc.) + Ma[b]rio[/b] = [b]Wario[/b]

[[Mario]]'s self-proclaimed rival. A crass, selfish, greedy anti-hero who sports superhuman strength. Frequently breaks the [[fourth wall]] in various promotional material.

Partner in crime with [[Waluigi]] and stars in his own series: [[Wario Land]] and [[WarioWare]]. 

His trademark appearance is having a [[yellow shirt]], a [[yellow headwear|yellow]] [[baseball cap|cap]] with a "W" and [[purple overalls|purple overalls]]. He also has [[white gloves]], [[green footwear|green]] [[pointy shoes]], a zig-zagged [[mustache]] and a big [[pink nose]]. He used to have long sleeves, but ever since [[Wario land II]] he is now depicted with having [[short sleeves]] to emphasize his [[muscular|muscles]]. 

h4. Official Art
* !post #7517674
* !post #7938198

h4.Related tags

* [[Baby Wario]]
* [[Wario-Man]]
* [[Wario Deluxe]]

title: waluigi
body:
[b]Wa[/b]rui ("ã‚ã‚‹ã„":[https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/%E3%82%8F%E3%82%8B%E3%81%84#Japanese], Japanese for bad, evil, etc.) + [b]Luigi[/b] = Waluigi

[[Luigi]]'s self-proclaimed rival. A sly, conceited schemer who secretly trains in order to defeat the Mario Bros, often competing against them in [[playing sports|sporting events]]. Partner in crime with [[Wario]]. 

His trademark appearance is having a [[purple shirt]] with [[long sleeves]] and a [[purple headwear|purple]] [[baseball cap|cap]] that has an upside down "L", along with a very dark [[blue overalls|blue]]/[[black overalls|black]] overalls. He also has [[white gloves]], [[orange footwear|orange]] [[pointy shoes]], a thin angular [[mustache]] and a hooked [[pink nose]].

While thought to be Wario's brother due to early official English material, various later official sources over the years have confirmed that the two have no familial relation.

h4. Official Art
* !post #7938200

title: aventurine_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
A playable character in [[Honkai: Star Rail]]. 

A member of the IPC Strategic Investment Department and [[Ten Stonehearts]]. [spoilers]Was born with the name "Kakavasha" during the flashback sequences as a child.[/spoilers] Voiced by [[Kawanishi Kengo]] (JP) and [[Camden Sutkowski]] (EN). 

He has [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]] and [[purple eyes]] with [[diamond-shaped pupils]]. His default outfit consists of a [[collared shirt|collared]] [[green shirt]] with a [[spade (shape)|]]-shaped [[clothing cutout]], [[black vest]], [[black jacket|black]] [[fur-trimmed jacket]], [[black gloves]], golden [[wristwatch]], [[white pants]], and [[black footwear|black shoes]]. 

h4. Costumes

* !post #7691387: Splash art
* !post #8768260: [[Aventurine (final victor) (Honkai: Star Rail)|Final Victor]]
* !post #7484063: [[aventurine_(star_rail_live_2024)_(honkai:_star_rail)|Star Rail Live 2024]]
* !post #7395386: [[Aventurine (anan) (Honkai: Star Rail)|AnAn]]
* !post #7368956: [[Aventurine (Bullseye) (Honkai: Star Rail)|Bullseye]]
* !post #7856110: [[Aventurine (Stoneheart's Oath Ring) (Honkai: Star Rail)|Stoneheart's Oath Ring]]
* !post #8474543: [[Aventurine (Jiaduobao) (Honkai: Star Rail)|Jiaduobao]]
* !post #8526747: [[Aventurine (Origami Bird) (Honkai: Star Rail)|Origami Bird]]
* !asset #24066783: [[Aventurine (Boss) (Honkai: Star Rail)|Boss]]

h4. Profile
[expand]
"Go ahead, use me as you wish, even stab me in the back when you see fit. Exploitation and treachery are simply tools of the trade. But remember, I don't make deals that don't pay off... So, I hope you don't disappoint me."

A senior manager in the IPC Strategic Investment Department and one of the Ten Stonehearts. His Cornerstone is "Aventurine of stratagems."
He possesses an air of frivolity and doesn't shy away from taking risks. His constant smile makes it difficult for people to discern his true feelings.

He won his current position by wagering against fate itself. He views life as a high-stakes, high-return investment, and he plays this particular gamble with masterful ease.
[/expand]

h4. See also

* [[Kakavasha (honkai: star rail)|]]

h4. External links

* "Honkai: Star Rail Wiki: Aventurine":https://honkai-star-rail.fandom.com/wiki/Aventurine

title: dr._ratio_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
Playable character in [[Honkai: Star Rail]]. Voiced by [[Takeuchi Shunsuke]] in Japanese. 

He is portrayed with [[short hair|short]] [[blue hair]] and [[yellow eyes]]. His default outfit is [[greco-roman clothes|Greco-Roman]] in style and comprises a [[black shirt]] top, [[white tunic]] with the Intelligentsia Guild's badge on the left breast side, [[blue pants]], and golden [[sandals]]. Often carrying his [[dr._ratio's_book_(honkai:_star_rail)|signature book]].

h4. Costumes
* !post #7691400: Splash art
* !post #7977851: [[Dr. Ratio (Academia) (Honkai: Star Rail)|Academia]]
* !post #7848610: [[Dr. Ratio (Final Victor) (Honkai: Star Rail)|Final Victor]]

His Chinese name çœŸç†åŒ»ç”Ÿ can be translated as Dr. Reason. Much like [[Dan Heng (Imbibitor Lunae) (Honkai: Star Rail)|"Imbibitor Lunae"]], Dr. Ratio's name is also taken from Latin, with "Ratio" meaning "Reason".

In some languages of the game, his name is Dr. Truth instead, which is an [i]acceptable[/i] translation though "Truth" is generally shown as çœŸç›¸ and not as çœŸç† which is what they use for his name. According to early leaks, his name was originally going to be "Doctor of Truth".

His full name is [spoiler]Veritas Ratio[/spoiler], which is Latin for [spoiler]Truth Reason[/spoiler].

h4. Profile
[expand]
"The most annoying thing about idiocy is that you can't explain it to an idiot."

A candid and self-centered Intelligentsia Guild member, who often conceals his appearance with a strange plaster sculpture. He demonstrated unparalleled intelligence and talent since his youth, but now refers to himself as a "Mundanite."

He firmly believes that intellect and creativity are not confined to geniuses. He seeks to distribute knowledge to the entire universe to cure the persistent disease named ignorance.
[/expand]

title: axe
body:
An [[tools|implement]] consisting of a wedge-shaped blade head attached to long handle.

As a tool, it is usually used to chop down trees or cut wood. As a weapon, it has a longer handle and a sharper, thinner, and sometimes double-edged head used to cleave and hack into opponents.

title: kamen_rider_gatack
body: Kamen Rider Gatack - Arata Kagami - is the fifth Rider in [[kamen_rider_kabuto_(series)|Kamen Rider Kabuto]], as well as the second Rider (besides Kabuto) to transform with a belt. Gatack has a black-and-blue color scheme, a red visor, and is patterned after a stag beetle, as evidenced by a pair of stag beetle horns on the sides of his helmet.

title: variant_keine
body:
A monstrous and twisted version of [[Kamishirasawa Keine]] (particularly her [[kamishirasawa keine (hakutaku)|hakutaku form]]) from [[Touhou Igyoukyo]].

She's a giant and grotesque [[hakutaku]], covered in eyes, [[extra arms]], a large mouth on her "torso", and a long neck to her human head, with its face twisted into itself, appearing as a spiral.
Her face can be "untwisted" to reveal her face, identical to her normal counterpart.

title: evillious_nendaiki
body:
Franchise by Akuno-P (mothy) about the continent of Bolganio, particularly the western half called Evillious, and the happenings throughout the millenium. Also known as [b]Evillious Chronicles[/b].

He tends to use the [[Vocaloid]] characters as the face claims for characters in the franchise, with [[Hatsune Miku]], [[Kagamine Len]] and [[kagamine_rin|Rin]], [[Megurine Luka]], [[MEIKO (vocaloid)|]], [[kaito (vocaloid)|KAITO]], [[Gumi]], and [[Kamui Gakupo]] recurring the most.

Notable sub-series within the Evillious Nendaiki are [[Aku no Musume (series)|]], [[Genzai Monogatari]], and [[E.A.T (mothy)|]].

[expand=Complete Song Listing]
All songs by mothy confirmed to be related to the Evillious Nendaiki are listed here in order of release.

The following songs are by mothy but [b]not[/b] confirmed to be part of the Evillious Nendaiki. This may change later, as mothy has been known to incorporate older seemingly disconnected songs into canon.
* [[Mukuchina Kimi e (vocaloid)|]]
** Described by [[Ma (evillious nendaiki)|]] in the [i]EVILS FOREST[/i] album as either being "the future or an illusion".
* [[Wendy (vocaloid)|]]
** The lyrics page for the song on the [i]Akutoku no Judgment ~a court of greed~[/i] album indicates the song is set in Marlon, though this may just be a reference to the original setting of the [[Peter Pan]] story being [[England]].
* [[Ourin no Honoo (vocaloid)|]]
* [[Machitsuzuketa Tegami (vocaloid)|]]
** Stated by mothy to be an abandoned sequel to the [[Aku no Musume (series)|]] story. Was later re-incorporated into canon with [[Reach For The Stars ~Machitsuzuketa Tegami~ (vocaloid)|]].
* [[Shiroi Renga to Kuroi Mofuku (vocaloid)|]]

title: variant_yuuka
body:
A monstrous, cruel, sadistic, and deviant version of [[Kazami Yuuka]] from [[Touhou Igyoukyo]].

Appears very similar to normal Yuuka, but with revealing, suggestive clothing and attached to an amalgamation of hostile flora, some of which seem to be sentient in their own right in some form. Most are differing types of [[carnivorous plant]]s, such as a [[venus flytrap]]-like plant monster and an oversized [[pitcher plant]]. Her "main" form is one of the few variants that look virtually identical to their normal counterpart.

body:
A corrupted and twisted version of [[Konpaku Youmu]] in [[Touhou Igyoukyo]] from a different world. Seldom seen outside of [[Sushi Yuusha Toro]]'s standalone art.

Looks like normal Youmu, but with an extra pair of arms and numerous, heavy scars all over her body. Her [[Konpaku Youmu (Ghost)|ghost]] half also has a sharp-toothed mouth and appears to have been impaled several times.

title: variant_reimu
body:
A twisted and evil version of [[Hakurei Reimu]] from [[Touhou Igyoukyo]] from another world.

Largely appears very similar to normal Reimu, but her face is a deformed [[yin yang]], with both smaller circles being black eyes and the division between the yin and yang being a toothy mouth. She also grows large metal needles off her back that are used as weapons. She only speaks in clicks and clattering, possibly due to the shape of her mouth.
[spoilers]Her "face" is speculated to be a mask, due in part to a non-canon spin-off comic where the variants are protagonists and also have to fight off corrupted doppelganger invaders.[/spoilers]

body:
An evil and twisted version of [[Kirisame Marisa]] from another universe, she was one of the main antagonists in [[Touhou Igyoukyo]].

Has large black irises, making her eyes appear almost entirely black and her face is unnaturally blackened with no visible mouth. [spoilers]She actually has a mouth, it becomes visible when she tears her own face flesh off to reveal it in one scene.[/spoilers]

title: itsuka_shidou
body:
The protagonist of the [[Date a Live]] story. He possesses a strange power that allows him to seal the powers of a Spirit in his body with a kiss.

He has 2 younger sisters: [[Itsuka Kotori]] (adoptive sister) and [[Takamiya Mana]] (biological sister).

Shido has the looks of a handsome young man in high school. He has straight blue hair and bands down to his neck and amber brown eyes. During the times where he borrows another Spirit's power, the color of his eyes turns into a more golden shade with dilated whitened pupils. He is often seen wearing the male [[Raizen High school uniform]] during his everyday life circumstances.

During the events of Miku Lily, Shido had to crossdress as a girl to interact with Miku, thereby disguising himself as his alternate identity, [[Itsuka Shiori]]. During the time, he was seen with long blue hair, and he wore the standard female Raizen High School uniform. He also wore a flower hair clip as a hair accessory. He is later able to become physically female via Haniel.

[spoiler]It was later revealed that originally Shido was [[Takamiya Shinji]].[/spoiler]

h4. See also

* [[Itsuka Shiori]] (his alter ego)
* [[Takamiya Shinji]] (his original form)

h4. External links

* "Date A Live Wiki: Shido Itsuka":https://date-a-live.fandom.com/wiki/Shido_Itsuka

title: army_of_the_republic_of_vietnam
body:
Posts containing references to the real life Army of the Republic of Vietnam, such as depictions of historical events, [[military vehicle]]s, or [[soldier]]s with clear evidence of the colors or uniforms of South [[Vietnam]].

h4. History

The Army of the Republic of Vietnam (ARVN) was the [[military]] arm of the anti-communist nation of South Vietnam, from the country's inception during the post-colonial division of Indochina in 1955, until the reunification of Vietnam in 1975. During those twenty years, ARVN was effectively in a constant state of war against [[communism|communist]] forces: fighting both a [[guerilla]] insurgency in the south of the country against the [[viet cong|National Liberation Front]], and a conventional conflict in the north of the country against the North Vietnam's military arm, the [[People's Army of Vietnam]] (PAVN).

Even after the mass deployment of American and Allied forces in 1965, ARVN forces continued to bear the brunt of the fighting during the [[Vietnam War]]. Unfortunately, ARVN also became more and more tied to the politics of South Vietnam, and political officer appointments, corruption and factional infighting continually degraded the army's ability to continue the conflict. Despite these issues, ARVN's efforts continued to prove decisive, from 1967 to 1968 to 1972.

The withdrawal of Allied troops in 1973, end of American supplies in 1974, and PAVN offensive in 1975 together proved to be the death knell for South Vietnam. Though ARVN troops continued to fight bravely in places, even lacking arms and ammunition, the country they fought to defend was rapidly collapsing. On 30 April 1975, PAVN forces captured the South Vietnamese capital city of Saigon (modern day [[Ho Chi Minh]] City), and what was left of the South Vietnamese government either surrendered or fled. The Army of the Republic of Vietnam, and the country said army was pledged to defend, had ceased to exist. 

h1. External links
* "Wikipedia: Army of the Republic of Vietnam":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Army_of_the_Republic_of_Vietnam

title: flandre_scarlet
body:
A [[Touhou]] character (alt. spelling Frandre, Flandoll, Frandoll). The "Diabolic Wave". Extra Stage boss of [[Touhou]]'s [[Embodiment of Scarlet Devil]] and Playable Character in [[Sunken Fossil World]].

The younger, mentally unstable sister of [[Remilia Scarlet]], sealed in the basement of the [[Scarlet Devil Mansion]] for 495 years because of her ability to cause wanton destruction. Despite her sheltered life, she is fond of her sister, usually never tries to leave the mansion, and in more recent works such as [[Foul Detective Satori]] has shown a remarkable growth in stability and self-awareness. Flandre is easily distinguished by her unique, [[multicolored wings|multicolored]] [[crystal wings]].

Sometimes drawn with her weapon, [[Laevatein (touhou)|]]. Alternatively, it might be depicted as a tail; see [[laevatein (tail)]].

title: princess_leia
body:
Female protagonist of the original trilogy of [[Star Wars]] [[science fiction|sci-fi]] and [[fantasy]] series, and main protagonist of the [[Star Wars: Leia Princess of Alderaan]] book series.

She is a leading member of the [[Rebel Alliance (star Wars)|]] [spoiler]and [[Luke Skywalker]]'s younger twin sister[/spoiler]. Strong and beautiful, she catches the eye of [[Han Solo]] and an unlikely relationship blossoms between the two. 

She was played by the late American actress [[Carrie Fisher]] in the three original films from the 70s and 80s, and in [[Star Wars: The Force Awakens]] and [[Star Wars: The Last Jedi]] for the sequel trilogy.

title: commission
body:
An image that was drawn as a paid commission, i.e. when someone hires an artist to draw for them.

Make sure the word 'commission' is visible in the image, or is mentioned in artist commentary, if you have no other proof.

If the post was commissioned on specific image site, apply the tags of where the commission was made accordingly.

This tag is for personal commissions; for commissions for a company, commercial work or otherwise established copyright, use [[official art]] instead.

h4. Commission sites

* [[ko-fi commission]]
* [[pixiv commission]]
* [[skeb commission]]
* [[vgen commission]]
* [[fiverr commission]]

h4. See also

* [[art trade]]
* [[commissioner insert]]
* [[commissioner name]]
* [[commissioner upload]]
* [[gift art]]
* [[guest art]]
* [[request inset]]
* [[second-party source]]
* [[third-party source]]

title: commissioner_upload
body:
A work that was uploaded to Danbooru by the person who [[commission]]ed it.

If the work was received privately from the artist rather than being publicly posted, or that it is different from version publicly posted by the artist (such as having higher resolution, lack of censorship, watermark, etc.), then the source may be left blank, left as the filename, or description of where the commission was delivered. [[Non-web source]] tag may be applicable if the artist have not posted that version of the work online.

If the work was posted to another site by the commissioner, please use [[second-party source]] instead.

title: marida_cruz
body:
A character in [i][[Gundam Unicorn]][/i], [b]Marida Cruz[/b] was originally known as "[[puru_12|Ple Twelve]]", a clone of [[Elpeo Puru]]. Marida was awakened by [[Glemy Toto]] and fought with her sisters during the first [[Neo Zeon]] movement. 

After the fight with [[Chara Soon]] in U.C.0089.1.17, [spoiler]she was one of the only surviving clones and was later taken by slave traders. She was later sold into sex slavery, in a colony brothel. Although her handlers thought she was too young to be a prostitute, the Madam thought there are pedophiles that would be interested in such youth.[/spoiler] 

Before coming under the protection of [[Suberoa Zinnerman]], [spoiler]Marida experienced countless pregnancies and abortions and her body is scarred from the abuse of her brutal customers.[/spoiler] Afterwards, she was rescued and taken in by a [[Neo Zeon]] faction to become a [[mobile_suit|MS]] pilot once again.

title: gaen_izuko
body:
Gaen Izuko is a mentor and leader of sorts to the other "oddity" specialists in the [[Monogatari (series)|Monogatari series]]: [[Oshino Meme]], [[Kaiki Deishuu]], [[Kagenui Yozuru]], and [[Teori Tadatsuru]], who also comprised her "Occult Research Club" in college. She has a reputation for being powerful and knowledgeable in the series, and her catch phrase is "I know everything".  She is the younger sister of [[Gaen Tooe]] and aunt of [[Kanbaru Suruga]].

Appearance-wise, she has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] that typically [[hair over one eye|covers one of her]] [[brown eyes]].  Her typical attire is hip-hop inspired, consisting of a [[green hat|green]] and [[white hat|white]] [[baseball cap]] as a [[hat]] (often [[sideways hat|worn sideways]]), a [[green shirt|green]] [[off shoulder|off]][[off-shoulder shirt|-shoulder]] [[t-shirt|t-]][[shirt]], [[red pants]], and dark [[red footwear|red]] [[flats]] for [[shoes]].  For accessories, she usually wears red [[prayer beads]], a yellow [[star (symbol)|star-shaped]] [[pendant]] [[necklace]], black [[wristband]]s, orange and yellow [[headphones]] (usually [[headphones around neck|around her neck]]), and carries multiple [[smartphone]]s.

title: harukawa_maki
body:
Character from [[Danganronpa V3: Killing Harmony]].

The Ultimate Child Caregiver. She was raised in an orphanage and often had to take care of the children younger than her there; despite this, she does not like children. A mostly coolheaded girl. Although she was initially shown as a primary character along with [[Momota Kaito]] and [[K1-b0]] in early promotional materials, neither of the three were the true protagonist.

She has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] divided into [[low twintails]] by two [[red scrunchie|red]] [[hair scrunchie|hair scrunchies]]. Her [[school uniform]] is a red [[serafuku]] with a black [[plaid skirt|plaid]] [[pleated skirt]], and wears [[red thighhighs]]. She has a [[mole under eye|mole under her eye]].

[spoiler]At the end of Chapter 2, it is revealed that she is actually the Ultimate Assassin, using the title of Ultimate Child Caregiver as a cover to hide this.[/spoiler]

title: yatadera_narumi
body:
[b]Magical Jizo who Manifested in the Forest[/b]

[i][[Touhou]][/i] character introduced as the stage 4 boss in [i][[Hidden Star in Four Seasons]][/i].

She has [[long earlobes]], [[long hair|long]], [[black hair]] tied in [[twin braids|two braids]] and [[red eyes]]. She wears a [[snow]]-covered [[ajirogasa]] along with a [[grey dress]] adorned with big red [[buttons]]. A [[capelet]] is wrapped around her neck with a [[ribbon]]. The [[clothes writing|writing]] on her capelet reads "ç•¢ç«Ÿæˆä½›", meaning "ultimate attainment of Buddhahood". She dons a pair of [[sandals]] with [[red socks]] while standing on her [[tiptoes]]. Her portrait depicts her [[own hands together|holding her hands together]].

Originally a "jizou":[/wiki_pages/jizou] statue, she came to life and became a magician of the Forest of Magic. She's friends with [[kirisame marisa|Marisa]], who calls her "Naruko" by mistake at times. Her abilities let her control the life force of living things.

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Yatadera Narumi":https://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Narumi_Yatadera

body:
An android representing the Japanese-made [[Howa Type 64]] [[battle rifle]] in the game [[Girls' Frontline]].

A slightly aloof, yet easygoing girl. She has [[blue eyes]], [[small breasts]], [[very long hair|very long]] [[brown hair]] with [[blunt bangs]] and [[blunt ends]] and long, luxurious [[drill sidelocks]], all topped with a [[white bow|white]] [[hair bow]]. 

Her main outfit is reminiscent of a formal [[school uniform]], with an upper portion composed of a [[red necktie]], an [[untucked shirt|untucked]] [[white shirt]], and a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[blue jacket|blue]] [[cropped jacket]] with white [[wrist cuffs]], [[black gloves|black]] [[fingerless gloves]], and a [[belt pouch]] attached to tactical [[strap|straps]] which also serve as a belt.

The lower half of the outfit is a [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[blue skirt|dark blue]] [[lace-trimmed skirt]], [[red pantyhose]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[cross-laced footwear|cross-laced]] [[combat boots]].

title: tewoarao-!
body:
A series of images in which beautiful girls, including anime characters, were used in [[poster (medium)|]]s produced by the Saitama prefectural government's medical maintenance division to promote the prevention of O-157 between 2001 and 2002.

Arguably the most notable posters produced during this time featured the characters of [[Azumanga Daioh]] illustrated by series creator [[Azuma Kiyohiko]] depicting [[Kasuga Ayumu]] looking [[looking at viewer|obliquely upward]] with both [[outstretched hand|hands stretched out]] [[outstretched arms|to the front]], with "æ‰‹ã‚’æ´—ãŠãƒ¼!" (Tewoaro-! - meaning "[[washing|Wash]] your hands!) inscribed with cute letters.

These were posted on public facilities in Saitama Prefecture, and in the [[bus]]es that traveled around the prefecture. Inspired by the public relations campaign, [[parody|parodies]] made with many characters have become popular on the [[Internet]]. In 2019, parodies of these posters made a resurgence due to the global COVID-19 pandemic.

title: imperialdramon
body:
An Ultimate-level Ancient Dragon  [[Digimon (creature)|]]. Traditionally shown to evolve from [[Paildramon]], it is featured in [[Digimon Adventure 02]] as the Jogressed Partner Digimon of [[Motomiya Daisuke]] and [[Ichijouji Ken]]. Its title is "Ruling Emperor Dragon" (å›è‡¨ã™ã‚‹çš‡å¸ç«œ, [i]Kunrin-suru Koutei-Ryuu[/i]).

In all of its guises, Imperialdramon bears [[red eyes]] and [[white hair]].

Imperialdramon has a number of forms and variants.
* [[Imperialdramon Dragon Mode|Dragon Mode]] â€” A quadrupedal [[dragon]] Digimon with huge, sharp claws [[claws]] on its forelegs, [[large wings|large]] [[wings]] and a [[cannon]] mounted on its back. Free attribute.
* [[Imperialdramon Fighter Mode|Fighter Mode]] â€” A bipedal dragon Digimon that has assumed a humanoid stance. Its cannon has moved to its right arm, and it now boast humanoid hands. Free attribute.
* [[Imperialdramon Paladin Mode|Paladin Mode]] â€” A further evolution of Fighter Mode that has gained [[Omegamon]]'s power, channeled through the [[Omega Blade]] [[greatsword]] in its hand. Vaccine attribute.
* [[Imperialdramon Dragon Mode (Black)|Dragon Mode (Black)]] â€” A black-colored variant of Dragon Mode that has surrendered to its destructive urges. Notably, it has a [[blue tongue]] and palate. Virus attribute.
* [[Imperialdramon Fighter Mode (Black)|Fighter Mode (Black)]] â€” A black-colored variant of Fighter Mode that has tamed the rampant power of its Dragon Mode and awakened to a heart of evil. It notably features its cannon on its left arm, of which it can extend its heat sinks to form a lance of energy. The crown on its head features a [[third eye]]. Virus attribute.

title: driver_(drive)
body:
The unnamed protagonist of the 2011 film [[Drive_(movie)|]], played by [[Ryan Gosling]].

The Driver's most iconic outfit is a [[white_jacket|white satin jacket]] with an embroidered gold [[scorpion]] on the back, accompanied with driving [[gloves]], skinny tight black [[jeans]] and light colored madison [[boots]]. He also carries a [[hammer]] for a weapon.

The Driver is known for being quiet, reclusive and emotionally isolated. His personality traits have been perceived as "relatable" by those who have watched the film, resulting in the Driver being lauded through internet discourse. Examples include memes and video edits of the film's scenes depicting the Driver as "literally me" to viewers. [[k_(blade_runner_2049)|Officer K]], another character [[Ryan Gosling]] has played in [[Blade Runner 2049]], also shares many similarities to the Driver, and are often featured together in memes along with other film characters Gosling has played over his career.

h4. See also

* [[Goslingposting (meme)]]

h4. External Links

* "Wikipedia: Drive (2011 film)":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Drive_(2011_film)

title: viewer_holding_leash
body:
A [[POV]] image where the viewer is holding a character's [[leash]].

The holding end of the leash must be held by the viewer, or at least implied. The receiving end of the leash must be on a character.

If the hands holding the leash are visible, add [[holding leash]] and [[pov hands]].

h4. See also

* [[bdsm]]
* [[viewer on leash]]

title: viewer_on_leash
body:
A [[POV]] image where the viewer is on the receiving end of a [[leash]].

The leash should be going to where the viewer's neck should be. The leash can be made of anything as long as the intent is to use it as a leash.

If a character's hands holding the leash on the viewer are visible, add [[holding leash]].

h4. See also

* [[femdom]]
* [[viewer holding leash]]

title: nexas_(vtuber)
body:
A defunct [[virtual YouTuber|VTuber]] agency whose talents all streamed on the streaming app [[AniLive]] that aimed to be an "academia" for talents aspiring to be the next generation of virtual stars. Later, most talents would start streaming on YouTube and/or Twitch, either stopping activities on AniLive completely, do streams on both AniLive and their platform that they stream on or do a mix of both AniLive and YouTube or Twitch (depending on what platform the talent debuted on) streams in a week based on their schedule. The company was founded by forCreators CEO Harry So, who is depicted as an [[owl]].

NEXAS completed angel funding in December 2023, launched in February 2024 and began operations in April of the same year. On December 9, 2024, NEXAS announced that it would cease operations as a talent agency on January 31, 2025, with talents getting the opportunity to keep their models and become [[indie virtual youtuber|independent]], instead becoming a hub to connect content creators with opportunities. On the day of its closure, it announced that "Phase 1" (the VTuber agency phase) had been completed, but they said that it wasn't over for them and that "Phase 2" would start later in 2025.

At the time of closure, it managed 61 members (24 in Class Genesis, 13 in Class Nebulink, 8 in Class Yume and 16 in Class Tensei). There were also 6 other members that have either graduated or gotten fired.

Not to be confused with the [[nexas|artist of the same name]].

title: gundam_suisei_no_majo
body:
A [[Gundam]] TV series that began airing in October 2022. Set in the Ad Stella (A.S.) timeline.

It is also the first main Gundam TV anime to feature a female Gundam pilot main protagonist and the fourth animated Gundam entry in any format to do this, following [[Gundam 0080]] (OVA, 1989), [[Gundam SEED C.E. 73: STARGAZER]] (ONA, 2006), and [[Gundam: Twilight Axis]] (ONA, 2017).

title: izumo_kasumi_(nijisanji)
body:
A formrer [[Nijisanji]] [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]]. Designed by [[Usuke (u skeeep)]].

She debuted in the first wave of Nijisanji SEEDs. Later she would be integrated into the main Nijisanji group in December 2018 before graduating on October 31, 2020.

title: shibuya_hajime
body:
A [[Nijisanji]] [[virtual Youtuber|VTuber]], part of the inaugural batch of eight. Designed by [[Hoojiro]]. 

He is portrayed as a young man with bright [[green hair]], [[blue eyes]], and is wearing [[glasses]]. 

His default attire consists of a black [[hood]]ed [[track jacket]], [[white shirt]] underneath, [[black pants]] with the left leg side [[pants rolled up|rolled up]], and [[slippers]]. One of the more technically minded members, he provided a lot of technical support to his peers. He was the only male presenting character of the original cast.

title: douki-chan_(douki-chan)
body:
An unnamed character by [[Yomu (Sgt Epper)]], and the protagonist of [[Ganbare Douki-Chan]]. An [[office lady]] who has an unrequited crush on her co-worker [[Douki-kun (douki-chan)|]]. Unfortunately for her, her attempts to pursue her colleague are often sabotaged by other women, including her rival [[Kouhai-chan (douki-chan)|]] and [[Senpai-san (douki-chan)|]].

She has [[brown hair|brown]] [[tied hair]] and usually wears a blue [[dress shirt]] with a [[pencil skirt]], red underwear and [[see-through legwear|sheer]] [[brown pantyhose]].
